loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay field workers to clean his farm and buy fertilizers so that his plants grow and increase his production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria de 61 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada a su familia. Después del abandono de su esposo, ha luchado por sacar a sus dos hijos adelante y brindarles mejores oportunidades. Inicio laborando como vendedora ambulante, recorriendo las calles de su localidad vendiendo toda clase de dulces. Posteriormente gracias a la alcaldía municipal le brindaron la oportunidad de colocar su negocio en  una chaza. Hoy se siente satisfecha porque su calidad de vida hay mejorado considerablemente. 
Con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y expandir su negocio, María se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and is dedicated to her family. Since her husband abandoned her, she has fought for her two children to be able to get ahead and have better opportunities. She started working as a street vendor, going around her city to sell all kinds of sweets. The city government later gave her the opportunity to set up her business in a food stall.

Today, she is satisfied because her quality of life has improved considerably. With the aim of raising her income and expanding her business, Maria is asking for a loan in order to invest in purchasing goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Hernán Obdulio

texts.es:
Hernán  es una de las víctimas del conflicto entre bandas urbanas del país. En el año 2008 fue desplazado por las bacrín  de su comuna, en donde residía con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Lo que los obligó a iniciar de cero y buscar alternativas para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Decidió subemplearse, debido a que por su condición educativa las puertas al mundo laboral se le cerraron.  Se dedicó a la venta de papitas de manera ambulante;  de esta manera a logrado sobrevivir y brindarles educación a sus dos hijos.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima (papa) y una vitrina con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y poder garantizar  en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hernán is a victim of the conflict existing among urban gangs in the country.  In 2008 he was displaced by guerrillas in his commune where he lived with his wife and two children.  This forced them to start again from zero and to seek alternative ways of earning their daily bread.  He decided to under employ himself because the door to the world of work were closed to him due to his educational condition.  He started selling potatoes from place to place thus managing to survive and provide schooling for his two children. Today, he’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials (potatoes) and a display case to improve sales and be able to guarantee better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and a display case.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro, tiene 50 años de edad, labora como mecánico desde hace ocho años, en un pequeño taller ubicado en el municipio de Bello, Antioquia. Gracias a la buena labor que realiza en el sector su clientela se ha incrementado, permitiéndole garantizar a sus dos hijos mejores condiciones de vida.  Uno de sus mayores anhelos es mejorar su la su condición económica y poder asegurar una educación de calidad a sus dos hijos. Razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas con el fin de garantizar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Ramiro, 50, has worked as a mechanic for 8 years in a small shop located in Bello, Antioquia.  Thanks to the good work he does in the sector his clientele has increased making it possible for him to guarantee better living conditions for his two children.  One of his greatest hopes is to improve his economic condition and be able to insure quality education for his two children which is the reason why he’s motivated to request a loan to buy tools in order to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy hand tools.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Hace 2 años montó su propia tienda y luego abrió una sala de internet en su propia casa. Es una mujer trabajadora y con gran esfuerzo ha logrado posicionar sus negocios en el sector donde reside y sacar su familia adelante. El crédito que solicita lo dese invertir en la compra de dos pantallas planas de computador, otro computador y una impresora, con el fin de prestarle un servicio más completo a sus clientes, con tecnología actualizada. Su principal sueño es hacer crecer sus negocios con el fin de incrementar las ventas y aumentar sus ingresos económicos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Justa is a 53 year old woman who is married and has 2 children. Two years ago she started her own store and then opened an internet cafe in her own house. She is a hard-working woman and with a lot of effort has managed to locate her businesses in the area that she lives in and help her family get ahead.

She wishes to invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of two flat screen computer monitors, another computer and a printer, with the goal of providing a more complete service to her custormers with up-to-date technology. 

Her main goal is to foster growth in her businesses with the goal of increasing sales and increasing their revenue in order to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to  buy 2 flat screen computer monitors, another computer and a printer

loans.name: Nelida Rosa

texts.es: Nélida Rosa a sus 37 años de edad, laboró por varios años en una empresa del sector financiero. Desde hace algunos meses optó por independizarse y crear su propio negocio dedicado a confeccionar bolsos y accesorios, los cuales comercializa en diferentes tiendas de su localidad.  Cuenta con un pequeño taller ubicado en su residencia. con el fin de posicionar su marca dentro del mercado local y poder consolidar su unidad productiva, brindándoles a otras personas la oportunidad de emplearse, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos-cuero, tela, pegante, entre otros-. Sueña con convertirse en una gran microempresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Nelida Rosa, 37, worked for several years for a firm in the financial sector.  A few months ago she decided to become independent and create her own business making purses and accessories that she sells in various local stores.  She has a small workshop at home.

In order to position her brand in the local marketplace and to be able to consolidate her productive unit providing sources of employment for others, she’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like leather, fabric and glue, among others.  She dreams with becoming a great successful micro businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy supplies like leather, fabric and glue, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Jorge Arnaut

texts.es:
Jorge nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, él tiene 66 años y tiene tres hijos.  

Jorge es carpintero de profesión pero también trabaja para el estado en el área desarrollo económico. Ya son varios años que se dedica a elaborar muebles de madera y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor De Torrechayoc” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pinturas y otras cosas más. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(La ciudad Paucartambo está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Jorge was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives with his family in the same city. He is 66 years old and has three children.

Jorge is a carpenter by profession, but he also works for the state in the area of economic development. He also makes dance masks for the feast of the patron saint of the city of Paucartambo. He has already made masks for a number of years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. He is an entrepreneurial and hard-working person who is raising his family. He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Torrechayoc" and at this time he needs a loan to buy working materials such as plaster, wire, paints, and other additional items.

He appreciates and values the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments.

(The city of Paucartambo is located in the district of Paucartambo in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like wood, nails, paint, and others

loans.name: Daney

texts.es: El Sr. Daney tiene 20 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Limoncito,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Daney va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de Yuca   y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Daney enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que las veces que saca el crédito lo utiliza para la siembra de sus productos ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene , una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Daney is 20 years old and works in agriculture sowing a variety of vegetables like potatoes and yuca, on his land which is in the community of Limoncito. This loan is his second with this institution. Daney is going to use this loan for the purchase of seeds for sowing yuca and preparing the land for sowing.

His reason for requesting this loan is to obtain the resources for the sowing and to be able to subsist. Daney is dealing with challenges in his business, like inclement weather which on many occasions ruins the crops. He will use the earnings to improve the quality of life of his customers and his family, since he is the one who covers all of the expenses at home. He is a responsible and hard-working person. He feels thankful to the institution for the support provided, since the times that he takes out a loan he uses it for the sowing of his products. This is the only source of income that he has. Once he harvests his products, he sells them in the community's market.

loans.use: to sow yuca and prepare the land for sowing.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, él tiene 50 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.  

Sergio es carpintero de profesión pero también trabaja para el estado en el área desarrollo económico como asistente, él también tiene un taller en su domicilio donde elabora diferentes muebles de madera como por ejemplo carpetas, sillas, roperos, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor De Torrechayoc” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(La ciudad Paucartambo está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Sergio was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives there with his family. He is 50 years old and in a common-law relationship from which he has three children.  

Sergio is a carpenter as a profession, but he also works for the state as an assistant in the area of economic development. He also has a shop in his home where he makes a variety of wooden furniture, such as cabinets, chairs, closets, etc. He has already been working in this business for many years and it is going very well thanks to the energy he puts into his work. Sergio is an enterprising and hard-working person who provides for his family. He belongs to the communal bank “Señor De Torrechayoc,” and he needs this loan to buy work materials, such as wood. Sergio appreciates and values the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments. 

(The city of Paucartambo is located in the Paucartambo district in the Paucartambo province within the department of Cusco, Perú.)

loans.use: to buy work materials, such as wood.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra.Rosa; la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "IMA SUMAC SUNCCO" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province and administrative division of Cusco. 

The member's name is Rosa and she continues to earn a living raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She raises the small animals to later sell them to clients who request them. 

She hopes to be able to continue working in this business to continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs for her business. She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean his farm and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Hace 3 años tiene una tienda donde vende todos los productos de la canasta familiar, con lo cual ha generado ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Es una mujer luchadora y con gran esfuerzo ha logrado que su negocio sea reconocido en el sector. El crédito lo desea invertir en mejoras locativas para su negocio y en compra de surtido (lácteos, huevos, carnes frías, productos de aseo, entre otros), con el fin de que el negocio se vea más agradable y poder tener la disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer la alta demanda de su clientela. Su mayor sueño es tener un minimercado, que le genere mayor nivel de ingresos y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is a 37-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. She has had a store for three years where she sells all the products typically used by a family and which has generated income for her so her family can get ahead. She is a tenacious woman and she has managed to make her business recognised in the sector through a lot of effort. She wishes to invest the loan in obtaining a better location for her business and in purchasing stock (dairy products, eggs, cold cuts of meat, toiletries, etc.) with the goal of making the business more appealing and having the product availability to satisfy the high demand from her clientele. Her greatest dream is to a have a mini supermarket, which would generate a higher level of income and thereby enable her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a better location for her business and to purchase stock (dairy products, eggs, cold cuts of meat, toiletries, etc.)

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y la alegría de sus pobladores. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería mecánica.

Día a día Saul trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; él cree que está  saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Saul está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena, hormigón, entre otros, para poder realizar refacciones en la vivienda donde habita, lo cual podrá mejorar la habitación donde habita, con lo cual mejorar su calidad de vida, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realizar su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y terminar de construir la vivienda de su familia con material noble”.
texts.en:
Saúl, 22, lives in the city of Chincha noted for its hot climate and the joy of its residents.  Because of his limited economic resources he was only able to attend fifth grade in secondary school but would have liked to have studied Mechanical Engineering.

Saúl works day to day as a laborer on a large agricultural estate in his city; he works about 9 hours daily and believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible.

Saúl is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided him he will be able to buy supplies like cement, sand and gravel, among others to do some improvements in the house he lives in which will make it possible for him to improve the room he lives in that will in turn improve his quality of life and he can continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to attend university and finish building his family’s house out of substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy building supplies like cement, sand and gravel, among others.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 15 years.

Merlinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Criselda has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has had for five years. Criselda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Criselda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Elenita

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Ma. Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Elenita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, bamboo and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, bamboo and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 56 years old and has eight children. She is a widow, and has two children who are in school.

Alfreda is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. Alfreda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alfreda has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. Marina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to resell. Marina has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Marina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to resell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years; she earns more income from selling personal products.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothing to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married, and has a bakery business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 3 years.

Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc..

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 43, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a pig fattening business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 18 years.  Amelita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Mere Jean

texts.en:
Mere Jean is 20 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mere Jean has a fishing vending business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for two years.  Mere Jean requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Mere Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business selling clothes in the Philippines.  Lelia has been in this business for 20 years.

Lelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

In the future, Lelia would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  Letecia has been in this business for 2 years; she earns more income from a general store, food vending and a parlor (services).

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional linens, thread and other tailoring materials for her tailoring business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional linens, thread and other tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. Elsa has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Enocincia

texts.en: Enocincia works hard to support her family. Enocincia is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Enocincia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to resell. Enocincia has been in this business for 25 years now. In the future, Enocincia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to resell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is 59 years old with nine children, two of whom are in school. She is works very hard as an entrepreneur to support her family. Feliciana has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional gallon of coconut wine to resell. Feliciana has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Feliciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional gallon of coconut wine to resell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila works hard to support her family. Mila is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mila requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Mila has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Mila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bananas to resell for her buy-and-sell banana business. Flor has been in this business for seven years. Flor earns more income from farming vegetables. Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to resell.

loans.name: Franklyn

texts.en: Franklyn is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Franklyn is 28 years old and has three children who are in school. Franklyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Franklyn requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to resell. Franklyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Franklyn would like to save money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en: Gemmalyn is 23 years old, married and has two children who are in school. Gemmalyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemmalyn requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Gemmalyn has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Gemmalyn would like to save money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Imelda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business. Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 26 years old, is married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost three years, earning PHP 300 daily. She's also a retailer of gasoline for an additional source of income. Due to lack of capital, Susan decided to request a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, detergent, soaps, canned goods, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can generate more income in her retail store.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, detergent, soaps, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Rosemaries

texts.en:
Rosemaries is 37 years old and married with four children, three in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemaries is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemaries has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from a general store and charcoal making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 42 years old, married and has six children, two in school.

Mercidita is in the business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercidita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercidita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rica is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rica has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda works hard to support her family. Gerarda is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Gerarda requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerarda has been in this business for six years now.

Gerarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 38 years old and has five children. Rosita is married and has four children who are in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rucenie

texts.en:
Rucenie is 27 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rucenie is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rucenie has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 52 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Guillerma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, etc., for her food production business.

Guillerma has been in this business for 10 years. Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with eight children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candy, canned goods, eggs, etc..

Letecia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Letecia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candy, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 35 years old, is married and has five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from vegetable sellers in the market.

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 35 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She is a banana vendor and has been in operation for almost 2 years.  With this, she's earning a net income of PHP 2,000 a week. Due to insufficient capital, Elvie decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase more bananas to sell. She hopes that her business will improve so she can earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 37 years old, she is married and has three children. She comes from Msambweni, and she has been running a carpentry business from her house for 2 years, building all kinds of furniture.
Paulina has a great desire to progress and get ahead in life. She is a very hardworking and resourceful woman. She offers her furniture all over town, in particular to schools and private buildings.
She is requesting a loan to buy wood and other supplies to keep on building her furniture, thus satisfying her customers’ requests. She is grateful for the chance she has been given as this loan will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is 26 years of age and is a high school graduate who farms to earn his main source of income. He is married and they are blessed with one child who serves as his inspiration to work every day.  He works seven days a week on his farm in order to create higher yields and income. His net income monthly is about PHP 3,000 - PHP 5,000. Now, Federico is asking for financial assistance to develop his farm, so he would like to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds.  He hopes that through this financial support his profits will grow and he will improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
To make a living, Nath is dedicated to farming, working alongside her husband on their own farmland in Kompong Cham province. They have been farming for more than 20 years and earn a net profit of $4.00 per day from this work. Nath is 47 years old and has seven children; three of them are are still dependent on Nath and her husband.

She has requested a loan of 1,300 US dollars, which will be used to buy a motorcycle for her two employed sons for commuting to their workplaces. She hopes that the loan will enable her sons to cut down their expenses on traveling and help them get to work on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her two employed sons for commuting to their workplaces.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 28, is from Msambweni and is married to Hamisi who is a fish monger. They have three young children who go to school, and they fight for their children's future because they want them to become good people and to be able to study to progress in life.

Mwanakombo has a fruit and vegetable business at the local market, and has two stalls. She says that she has many regular customers, giving her a good income. She is a very hardworking woman, with excellent customers. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables, in order to continue her business and generate revenue to help her family and give them what they need.

loans.use: to purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ashiroy

texts.ru: Аширой 52 года. Она замужем, имеет четверых детей и проживает со своей семьей в районе Дж.Руми. Аширой вместе с мужем занимается земледелием и выращивают сельскохозяйственную культуру. Его старший сын женат, сейчас он сам находится на заработках за пределами страны. Его жена недавно научилась кройке и шитью, и теперь хочет применить свое умение на деле. Аширой хочет помочь своей невестке в открытии собственного дела и поэтому обратилась за кредитом для покупки компьютерной швейной машины модели Yamata. Ее невестка планирует в день вышивать по два платья. Она может шить и обычное платье и платье с красивыми вышивками, которое стоит дороже. По словам Аширой швейный бизнес является прибыльным в их районе, так как многие девушки и женщины покупают ткани и отдают их портнихам для шитья платья.
texts.en: Ashiroy is 52 years old. She is married and has four children and lives with her family in the J. Rumy region. Ashiroy and her husband do land cultivation and grow field crops. Her oldest son is married and now works abroad. His wife has recently learned to sew and now wants to apply her skills in business. Ashiroy wants to help her daughter-in-law to open her own business and that's why she came for a loan to buy an electronic sewing machine by the make of Yamata. Her daughter-in-law plans to make two dresses a day. She can sew a simple dress and a dress with beautiful embroidery which costs more. Ashiroy says that the sewing business is profitable in their region because many women and young girls buy fabrics and give them to seamstresses to make dresses.

loans.use: to buy a Yamata electronic sewing machine to open a sewing business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years of age, married and has two children. While her husband is working abroad, she runs her retail store business in their village; this business serves as their source of income. Being a mother of her children, she always wants the best for them, and she also stands as a father of her children.

Rosemarie sells various types of grocery items in their village but she wishes to sell products that are seldom sold in their village. Due to financial constraints, Rosemarie can’t push her wishes, thus she is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy beverages, powdered milk and diapers for babies to sell. She hopes to improve her business and increase more income to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy beverages, powdered milk and diapers for babies to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 23, single, and lives in Msambweni with her one child. For the past year, Fatuma has operated her business of buying clothing and other products for resale. She has built up a very good customer base because of her good pricing and variety of products. With her work, she helps her family. For this reason, she wants to be able to invest in her business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase bales of Khangas (women's wrap cloth) because these are in high demand in this season. She is grateful for this opportunity, since it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: purchase of bales of Khangas (women's wrap cloth).

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a  53 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 7. She engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She has been selling fish for more  than 5 years now. Francisca requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and to pay for her fishing boat repairs. In the future, Francisca would like to expand her fishing business to provide her children with proper foods and quality education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to pay for her fishing boat repairs

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Standing and sitting for the whole day just waiting for customers who will buy her products is hard for Marinel. But, she will work just to meet her children's needs and give them a better way of living. Marinel has her stall in the market, where she sells dresses, bath soap, shampoo and shoes. 
She requests a loan of PHP 30,000 which is hard to pay in weekly payments, but Marinel will manage as she wants to achieve her goal which is to expand her business. According to her, someday her small stall will grow to be one of the biggest stalls in the market. Marinel will use the loan to buy different kinds of dresses, shampoo and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dresses, shampoo and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabeke  est membre du collectif d’affaire  « La victoire», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 24 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Son conjoint est un Agent de sécurité dans une compagnie de gardiennage. La cliente est sociétaire d’un petit kiosque des articles divers. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les articles divers (savons, lotion de beauté, bonbons, biscuits, allumettes, sucres, huile de table, sardines, pommades, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, acheter une parcelle, etc. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Kabeke is a member of the business group "La Victoire". She is a young experienced entrepreneur, aged 24, married, and a mother of two children. Her husband is a security guard in a company. 

Kabeke is an part-owner of a small kiosque selling various goods. She started this business with funds from her husband about three years ago.

This new loan is going to help her buy various goods (soap, beauty lotion, candy, cookies, matches, sugar, cooking oil, sardines, ointments, etc.). 

Kabeke wishes to expand her business, buy a piece of land, etc. To finish, she strongly thanks Hekima for its lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy various goods (soap, beauty lotion, candy, cookies, matches, sugar, cooking oil sardines, ointments, etc)

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu, 27, is married to Adam who is a farmer. The couple already has three children who came to gladden the family. 

Mwanaulu has had her snack bar business for one year, located in a very good spot in town. She has a well-established clientele because of the good service she provides. She also supplies other similar businesses with products that don’t require cooking. Their objective is to continue improving the service they offer and thus continue making progress.

She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials like flour, oil, meat, soft drinks and snacks, thus offering a variety of products to her customers and as a result, increasing her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like flour, oil, meat, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Majimbo

texts.en:
This is Majimbo. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 40,000 KSh, to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. 

The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Nyondo

texts.en:
Nyondo is a married man with seven school-going children. They live in a rental house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, he has operated a goat meat business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation.

With the KSh 30,000 he wants to purchase four goats for resale to his clients to facilitate the running of his business.

loans.use: to purchase four goats for resale to his clients to facilitate the running of his business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is from Msambweni. She is married and owns a small home based store. Her husband is a farmer with various crops. She has been blessed with seven school-going children.

Mariamu says that her store is a big help in the financial support of the home, since through this work and that of her husband they have been able to educate their children and give them what they need. She said that her dream is to have a larger commercial facility so she can obtain more customers and increase her earnings.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of coconuts in bulk, in order to continue selling and providing her customers with what they are looking for.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts in bulk for resale in her home based store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a 37 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children aged 9 and 12. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like sugar,  biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap. Her husband is a fisherma to earn a living. Violeta requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock like beverages, condiments, soft drinks and dry goods and to repair her husband's fishing boat. In the future, Violeta would like to expand her retail store business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock like beverages, condiments, soft drinks and dry goods and to repair her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: This time, Nenita is borrowing a new loan of PHP 10000 in order to purchase more coconut wine to sell to her customers. Her coconut wine business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, and it continues to provide for Nenita and her family, with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut wine to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Little by little Doris began increasing her sales, since she herself goes out to offer her products in the zone. She sells mostly clothing for women and children like blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts and sweatshirts. One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center. She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
This is Hadija. Her previous loan was a big help. She was able to buy stones to reconstruct her house and is now living in a permanent house. 

She would like to apply for another loan for 50,000 KES boost her weaving business, to buy more stock of weaving materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of weaving materials.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati operates a clothing-sales business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. In addition, Bahati operates a tailoring business to supplement her income. 

With the loan she is requesting, Bahati wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: A mother of three children in her early 40s, Vanna is a villager who grows rice on a three hectare area; it is the business that she has had for about 20 years, earning roughly 27,200 KHR per day. Including this loan, Vanna is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loans she has repaid, Vanna feels confident that she can upgrade her living condition better than before. Now, she is applying for a new loan order to buy a decent hand-tractor to support her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will unburden the transportation cost which she used to cover.

loans.use: To buy a decent hand-tractor to support her farmland

loans.name: Thuon's Group

texts.en: Thuon is 58 years old and a married mother of five children. To tackle the daily food consumption issue, she does rice farming on a seven hectare area as the main income source, which she has been doing for 20 years. Thuon has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles. She has fully repaid her past loan wisely, to support her business sufficiently and better than before. Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. The entire group loan is 2,400,000 KHR each. For Thuon, whose loan portion is 1,200,000 KHR, the loan portion will be spent to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop in a timely manner and gain a double yield, that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash for her farmland

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past 6 years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

Tasleem is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more stock of thread, fancy materials, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fancy material, sequins, and pearls of various colors for sewing dolls to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and from Msambweni. She has a shop in Msambweni where she sews and sells women’s clothing and other types of garments.


Mary has been sewing since 2010 and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items so that she can continue her production. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to move forward so that she can grow. Mary appreciates the opportunity she has received, since it will allow her to continue growing and improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Meriam requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and other snack foods for her business.

Meriam has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Meriam would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and other snack foods for her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loading and a general store. Luz is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of medicine for her buy and sell medicine business.

Luz successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. 

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of medicine for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 5 children. The oldest child is 18, while the youngest is 9. Teresita is engaged in farming; she grows rice. Aside from farming, Teresita also engages in a buy and sell business. She sells frozen products like chorizo and hotdog to augment her income. Teresita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more frozen products and fertilizers. In the future, Teresita would like to expand both businesses to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more frozen products and fertilizers

loans.name: Pisan

texts.en:
Pisan is 35 years old and married with four children.

Pisan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like noodles, coffee, sugar, biscuits, laundry soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Pisan has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Pisan aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like noodles, coffee, sugar, biscuits, laundry soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolphina

texts.en:
Dolphina sells fruits and vegetables. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to transport her goods for a better market. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her business, trying to sell more and save money in order to obtain a more formal establishment. Dolphina is requesting a loan to buy sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Kigera Group

texts.fr:
Lameck fait partie du groupe  Kigera  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 40 ans et est marié à  Kabura, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 12 enfants  âgés de 1 à 20 ans.
  
Il fait le commerce de bière et de limonade depuis  11ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  caisses de bière et de limonade à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Le gain de son commerce lui a permis d’acheter des terrains cultivables, et a construit une maison. Dans les années à venir, il voudrait   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Lameck, age 40, is a member of Kigera Group and he lives in Rumonge. He is married to a Kabura, a cultivator. Together, they have 12 children, aged 1 to 20.

He's been selling beer and lemonades for elven years, and is now seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this loan, he will bolster his working capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade, in order to increase his income.

The earning generated by his business enabled him to buy cultivable lands and build a house. In the forthcoming years, he would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to buy many cases of beer and lemonade

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 58, is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruit and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 10 years. She has a place in a popular market in Msambweni where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

She is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her workday very early.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fruit and vegetables so that she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a very hardworking, enterprising person. She relates that she works making children’s clothes, school uniforms and others.

Thanks to her work always being of very good quality, she is growing and improving every day. She defines herself as a person who works hard and who wants to get ahead.

Mary is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, elastic and other materials, because these are the main supplies she uses to produce good quality articles of clothing for her customers. She dreams of continuing to grow her business and to become known by more customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, elastic and other materials to produce good quality articles of clothing for her customers.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past five years, Kadzo has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting, Kadzu wants to purchase 6 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is Martha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy charcoal. 

She would like to apply for another loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Yoeurng's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province,Yoeurng is 42 years old and a parent of two schoolchildren. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice cultivation on a two hectare area. Yoeurng has engaged in this business for 20 years and it has returned her about 11,400 KHR per day. Yoeurng wants to improve sanitation practice in her family. Therefore, she formed a group of two, to apply for a loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes to own a proper latrine for her family, especially for her kids.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

loans.name: Ricardo Alcides

texts.es:
Ricardo cuenta con 42 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Muchas personas de la comunidad lo conocen como alguien trabajador y muy responsable con las actividades de la comunidad. Tiene ya más de 35 años de trabajar la agricultura actividad que desempeña con gran experiencia, además él sabe de construcción. Actualmente, trabaja desempeñando las dos actividades las cuales le generan los ingresos para su familia.   

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para limpiar el terreno y cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Una de las necesidades en satisfacer es la producción de maíz; ya que su compañera de vida de eso trabaja vende el maíz en porciones pequeñas y elabora y vende tortillas, lo cual les genera los ingresos diarios para el sustento de su familia.  

Él lo que busca es una mejor estabilidad económica y alimenticia de la familia a parte de brindar trabajo a los miembros de la misma familia; ya que es una actividad que desarrolla con uno de sus hermanos, además de poder brindar mayores comodidades a su familia. 

Uno de sus planes es brindar un mejor estudio a sus hijos; ya que él no quiere que tengan un futuro incierto, además quiere comprar una pequeña novilla para poder venderla una vez este este totalmente desarrollada, y así comenzar una actividad ganadera que le podrá generar más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and has a partner and two children. He is known by many people in his community for being hardworking and very responsible in community activities. He has been working in agriculture for more than 35 years and has a lot of experience in carrying out this work. He also knows about construction. He is currently working in both areas, which give him income for his family.

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilisers, pesticides and weedkiller and to pay for labour to clear the land and cultivate 7,000 square metres of corn.

He needs to be able to produce corn since his partner works selling the corn in small quantities and also makes and sells tortillas. This gives them the daily income necessary to sustain the family.

What Ricardo would like is a better economic stability and more secure food provision for the family by providing work for other members of his family. He already works with one of his brothers. He also wants to provide for the family so they can live more comfortably.

One of his plans is to provide better education for his children as he does not want them to have an uncertain future. He also wants to buy a young cow which he will be able to sell when it is fully grown, thus starting out working with livestock. This will be able to generate more income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, pesticides and weedkiller and to pay for labour to clear the land and cultivate 7,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Phloeun

texts.en: Phloeun is a rice grower from Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, which is where her residential area is. She is 52 years old and blessed with eight children. Currently, only two kids still rely on her, as they are in school. The entire household mainly depends on three hectares of rice farming. Phloeun and her husband also work for others for a fee, for extra income. Phloeun has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy potash, fragrant rice seed, and gasoline for a hand-tractor. She hopes that she can make more income so that she can set aside some money for any needs in the future.

loans.use: To buy potash, fragrant rice seed, and gasoline for a hand-tractor.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school, while one is still very young. Purity owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past three years, Purity has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting, Purity wants to purchase 2 bunches of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bunches of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Mom is a parent of two kids. For her family, corn growing is the primary source of income, which has returned about 40,000 KHR per day from the business. Mom has been doing this business for 10 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a sixth-cycled client, including this loan. Mom can afford to cover the three decent meals for her kids sufficiently; this positive impact is a result from the successful past loans which she has repaid back completely. Now, she forms a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Mom will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can minimize the loss due to pests which used to lower crop yield, and get back a good yield this time.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This time, Evelyn is applying for a new loan of 30000 PHP in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.
Her general store business, previously funded through KIVA partner NWTF, continues to provide Evelyn and her family with an increased income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries,

loans.name: Sumera's Group

texts.en:
Sumera, age 33, is a married and a dedicated mother of three children. Her husband runs a cosmetics shop in which he offers his customers variety of cosmetics products such as lipstick, nail polish, scrub, hair dye, fairness cream, hair brushes, etc. Her husband wants to grow his business to meet the rapid increase in the household expenses of his family.

In order to purchase more cosmetics, Sumera contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way her husband will be able to buy more cosmetics to sell. This ultimately saves him time and hopefully will increase his net income. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to utilize the part of revenue for the betterment of her family members. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products such as lipstick, nail polish, scrub, hair dye, hair brushes, etc.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya, sont des femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, 7enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment d’articles divers et de la restauration.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur huitième prêt. 
La cliente Assetou,  assise au milieu  fait le commerce de charbon de bois et du savon. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois et 5 cartons de savons auprès des grossistes de Fana.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité. 
Elle ambitionne acquérir dans cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso 5 chèvres.
texts.en:
The members of Danaya Group are married women who average 37 years of age and seven children. They all live in extended traditional families in Fana, a town in Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They buy and sell condiments and various products, and run food-serving businesses. They are seeking their eighth loan.

Assetou is the woman sitting in the middle in the photograph. She buys and sells charcoal and soap. She intends to use her loan to buy 30 sacks of charcoal and five boxes of soaps from wholesalers in Fana. 

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30) to be used in part to provide for her family. The remainder will be reinvested in her business. Thanks to this collaboration with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, she ambitions to purchase five goats.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of charcoal and five boxes of soaps

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 59-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol in the Philippines. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like cooking oil, eggs, dried fish, canned goods, beverages and soft drinks. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like condiments, toiletries, noodles and soft drinks. In the future, Rebecca would like to expand her retail store business in preparation of the old age.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like condiments, toiletries, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Saipa

texts.en:
This is Saipa. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of used but quality shirts, shorts, blouses and pants. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used but quality shirts, shorts, blouses and pants. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Saipa dreams of expanding her business and having a store for her business. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets  with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of used but quality shirts, shorts, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Vilmar

texts.en:
Vilmar is 40 years old, married and has four children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vilmar has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Vilmar requested a loan of PHP 17000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy raw materials for her Abaca weaving business.

Vilmar has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vilmar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her Abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Diery

texts.en:
Diery is 55 years old and married with two children.

Diery works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like milk, canned goods, soap, etc.

Diery has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Diery aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 59 years old and widowed with five children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy dry goods such as foam, chairs, plastic cabinets and other dry goods for her business.

Dolores has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dry goods business for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dolores aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dry goods such as foam, chairs, plastic cabinets and other dry goods for her business.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Mr. Khalid is a 38-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Khalid has been running his own general store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 
He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc. But due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married and has been blessed with three school-going children and one is still young. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes in upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food-vending and farming vegetables. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables for her vegetables business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy  more foam, cotton, fabric, plastic, and other materials needed to make pillows.  Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 23,000 PHP loan to buy  more foam, cotton, fabric, plastic, and other materials needed to make pillows. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to  cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lydia dreams of being more successful in business and life. She attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship groupis composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build socialcapital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more foam, cotton, fabric, plastic, and other materials needed to make pillows.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en: Neria is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in seaweed farming, wherein, she grows seaweed. To be able to continue to run her farming activity, Neria requested a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippine peso) to buy straw, rope and additional seaweed seedlings, to produce more seaweed and increase sales. In the future, Neria would like to expand her business to improve their living status.

loans.use: to buy straw, rope and additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Latanya

texts.en:
LaTanya has been in business for over two years as a business consultant and advisor.  She began her company, JOLT! Consultants & Business Advisors, LLC in Houston, Texas back in 2007. JOLT! Is a full-service professional company comprised of four distinct business areas: JOLT! Workforce Solutions, JOLT! Consultants & business Advisors, JOLT! Project Management and JOLT! Small Business. Each department of JOLT! focuses on delivering exceptional services to our client.

LaTanya and her team provide recruiting in both the public and private sectors in the oil and gas, engineering, accounting, finance and many other fields.

One day while LaTanya was networking, she was informed about Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit microlender that loans money to small business and entrepreneurs.  She inquired and applied for a microloan and shortly after was approved for a $5,450 Accion loan.  The loan allowed LaTanya to cover her current and future payroll needs for her staff of six.

LaTonya’s future plans are to hire additional staff members and continue advising, recruiting, and making new contacts in the Houston area.

loans.use: to cover her current and future payroll needs for her staff of six.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffery is on a mission to create his own line of fashionable clothing. With three years of experience in fashion, Jeffery took action and completed business education preparatory classes at Youth Entrepreneur Incubators at the Elevate Entrepreneurship System, an organization that helps prospective business owners in Little Rock, Arkansas.  

Jeffery’s new venture helps brand other businesses by creating and printing logos on shirts. Jeffery is determined to further launch his business and has already invested his own funds in start-up costs. 

Through Elevate’s partnership with nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc., Jeffrey inquired about a loan to purchase more equipment and market his T-shirt making business, Cynosure. He applied and was approved for $5,450, providing him with the working capital he needed.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and begin his business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 47-year-old married father of three children. He has been working in transportation services since 1995.  Eight years ago he started his own business. He bought his own van and started transporting students to and from school in addition to working during his free time transporting people from one place to another around nearby villages.  Khaled is a hard worker.  

Two of his children are enrolled in a private school while the third is in a public school. It is hard for him to provide them with everything that they need, but he works hard to allow them to have the best education possible.  

His wife doesn't work as she's a housewife whose main responsibilities are to take care of her house and the family members.
