Avec ce prêt,  Mama  la personne à droite dans le rang des assises en tenue jaune, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil d’arachide et de haricot. Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SABOUGNOUMA III" are married women, who average 43 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Barakolobougou, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. And they are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and beans.

With this loan, Mama, who is sitting at the right and wearing a yellow outfit in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 1 hectare of millet, peanuts, and beans. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to men and women customers. She hopes to make a profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 49 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’articles divers  et de la restauration.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur vint deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Konimba 1 ère personne à partir de la droite,  fait le commerce d’arachide tous les jours. Elle compte acheter 300 kilos de graines d’arachide auprès des productrices des villages environnants.
Elle espère réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de  famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo is composed of married women averaging 49 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Préfecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments and a variety of goods, and they work in food service. The women of the group are on their 22nd solidarity loan.

This client, Konimba, who is the first person from the right in the photo, always does commerce in peanuts. She intends to purchase 300 kg of peanuts from women producers in the surrounding villages. 

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment d’articles divers, et de la restauration.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont à leur vint deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Fanta  1 ère debout de la droite vers la gauche vend les pâtés  à base de la farine, du charbon de bois  et des habits  pour enfants. Elle compte acheter de la farine de blé, du fagot et des condiments pour la confection de pâté, qui sera vendu en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité. Elle ambitionne avec la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso  d’acquérir des tôles et chèvres et de bien s’occuper du mariage de sa fille.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma, composed of married women, average 47 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments and a variety of goods, and they work in food service. The women of the group Sabougnouma are on their 22nd solidarity loan.

This client, Fanta, who is the first one standing from the right in the photo, sells pâtés made from flour, and she also sells charcoal and baby clothing. She intends to purchase some wheat flour, firewood, and condiments for making pâtés, which will be sold retail, cash or credit, to a diverse and varied customer base.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in her business. By collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso, her ambition is to acquire sheet metal [roofing material] and goats and to do better with her daughter's marriage.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make pâtés.

loans.name: Jiguisseme I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIMPIALA II, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec MARIAM  1ère debout de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called  JIGUISSEME I are married women with an average age of 44 and five children on average, all living in polygamous families in ZIMPIALA II, one of the villages of the Sous-Préfecture (county) of KOLONDIEBA, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Mariam, the first person standing in the photo, left to right,  grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. to cultivate one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in  KOLONDIEBA, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Mariam expects to make a profit of 85,500 F CFA each season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing etc. for this planting season.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more of the materials needed in her tailoring business. She also has a business buying and selling various silver accessories. Her business helps her with the studies of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies, such as fabrics, needles, and other items needed for her business. Her business profits will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the children’s education costs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Merlyn hopes to be a successful businesswoman and dreams that her children will have a good life. Every week, she goes to meetings with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fabric, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, 17 and 15. She engages in fishing. She catches crabs and sells them to the community. She has been engaged in fishing for more than five years. Dominga applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, weights and nylon. In the future, Dominga would like to expand her fishing business to support her children, especially by sending them for college education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, weights and nylon for her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 52-year-old married man with six children. For the past 10 years, he has been a farmer who grows crops and keeps cows that produce milk. Previously, he was involved in beekeeping. Henry describes himself as honest and faithful. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local consumers. Henry describes his biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of milk prices. 

Henry is requesting a 6,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp to enable him to cut the cost of fuel for his house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. His business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia works hard to support her family. Cecelia has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines. Cecelia applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bags of used shoes to sell. Cecelia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: As a parent of two children, Dolores works hard to support her family. She has a candy-making business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Dolores is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her candy-making business. Dolores has been maintaining her business activities with her first loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her candy-making business.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Eleuteria works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Eleuteria is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy supplies, including linen, thread and tailoring chalk, for her tailoring business. Eleuteria maintained her business activities with her past loan from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, including linen, thread and tailoring chalk, for her business.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 43 años con un grado de educación cursado hasta el tercer grado de primaria madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven y dependen de ella y su esposo. Fueron sus padres los que desde muy joven le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo ellos agricultores por tradición familiar específicamente al cultivo de café. Sus 2 hijos el primero tiene 20 años y estudia en tercero de secundaria y la segunda tiene 15 años está en segundo curso de ciclo común. En las actividades de campo solo se involucra la familia para hacer lo que es: limpia, abona, y corta de la cosecha. Las tierras que cultivan son obtenidas por herencia por parte de sus padres las cuales están a una distancia de 4 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder invertir en la compra de insumos para sus cultivos de café con los cuales ella quiere prevenir que sus cultivos sean dañados por la roya, plagas entre otros que hagan que su cosecha se pierda.

Su sueño es poder comprar más tierras para cultivarlas de café ya que así obtendrá mejores ingresos, mas ganancia para su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida, así mismo darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y lograr que ellos se gradúen en la universidad.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and has primary education up to third grade. She is a mother of 2 children who live with and are dependent on her and her husband. From when she was very young, her parents taught her how to work the land since they come from a family with a tradition of farming and specifically growing coffee. Her son is 20 years old and is studying in third grade of secondary school. Her daughter is 15 years old and is in the second year of general high school. The family are only involved in farming activities such as clearing, applying fertiliser and picking the harvest. The land which they cultivate was inherited from her parents and is 4 kilometres from their house, a journey which they make on foot.

María has asked COMIXMUL for a loan which she can spend on supplies for her coffee production. She hopes to prevent the crops being damaged by rust, one of the types of fungus which can cause the crop to be ruined.

Her dream is to be able to buy more land for growing coffee so that she can have a better income and more profit for her family and improve their standard of living, as well as giving her children a better education and enabling them to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Chouk's Group

texts.en: Chouk , from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 33 years old and married. She is blessed with three children, who are still in school. To support daily food consumption, she farms rice on a two-hectare area and cassavas on another half-hectare area. This business, which she has engaged in for 15 years, returns her about 25,000 KHR. Chouk has never borrowed from  VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is leading a group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, potash, and pesticide for her crops. She hopes to bring in her crops on time and earn a good income.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, potash, and pesticide for her crops.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Roert's Group

texts.en:
Roert is 48 years old and the married mother of five children, two of whom are still dependent on her as they are still in school. She lives a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Roert has been farming rice for 20 years in the village and currently earns about 30,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle.

Roert is the leader of a two-person group loan request. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. Roert hopes to increase her crop yield and profit to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Kanha is a 26-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are still too young. She is originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. Kanha makes a living selling grocery items in her village and her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, she and her husband can earn about 9,300 KHR per day and manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day. Kanha has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has completely repaid her loans. She used her loans to help better support her family.

Kanha is the leader of a two-person group loan request. Her partner is new to VisionFund. Kanha will use her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes her loan will enable her to earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, age 37, is an energetic married lady. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago, she began a sewing business in her house. She sews for the people living near her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000, to buy more spools of thread and packets of ribbons, elastic and zippers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and the packets of ribbons, elastic and zippers.

loans.name: Enyovi

texts.fr: Madame Enyovi âgée de 29ans est mère d'un enfant de 07ans scolarisé. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle tresse et revend en même temps des produits de détails(allumette, des cadenas...) et des produits de beauté(mèches et tissages). Son premier crédit sollicité à WAGES l'aidera à s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle espère à l'avenir agrandir son activité et assurer au mieux au bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Enyovi is 29 years old, and the mother of a seven-year-old child who attends school. To provide for her family, she braids hair and sells retail products (matches, padlocks), as well as beauty products (hair extensions and weaves).

Her first loan received from WAGES will help her to purchase merchandise and satisfy the needs of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and provide the best possible welfare for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair weaves, and retail goods.

loans.name: Zoila Yamileth

texts.es:
Zoila es una joven de 29 años de edad con un grado de educación de secundaria cursado hasta el segundo curso y madre de una hija de 4 años de edad. En compañía de su compañero de hogar se involucran en lo que es: limpieza, abono, fertilización, corte, entre otros. La tierra que cultivan son obtenidas por el esfuerzo propio por eso ella y su compañero de hogar trabajan fuertemente para que tener una mejor calidad de vida con una experiencia de 6 años. La agricultura es el único medio de ingreso económico para su familia por lo cual se dedica al 100% al cultivo de café. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 3.5 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie. 

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos agrícolas que evitaran el contagio de enfermedades, darán un mejor follaje, un mejor grano y estará más protegido de heladas y bichos. 

Ella sueña con ver a su hija convertida en una profesional siendo una persona exitosa mediante el estudio y mejorar sus cultivos de café dándoles una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila is 29 years old and has had education up to the second year of secondary school. She is the mother of a 4 year old daughter. Together with her partner she carries out tasks such as clearing land, applying manure and fertiliser and picking the harvest, among other things. She and her partner have worked hard for the last 6 years to have their own land to cultivate so that they can have a better quality of life. Agriculture is the family's only source of income and so they dedicate themselves 100% to growing coffee. Their crops are located 3.5 kilometres from their home and they make the journey on foot.

Currently Zoila is asking for a loan from the COMIXMUL co-operative to buy agricultural supplies which will prevent the plants being affected by diseases, will give better foliage and better beans and give the plants better protection from frosts and insects.

Zoila dreams of her daughter becoming a professional and being a successful person through studying, and of improving her coffee crops by giving them better care and attention in order to have a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertiliser and other supplies for her coffee production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tools for farming.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a Kiva borrower, age 30 years. He is married and has six children with ages between 3 years and 12 years.

He owns a farm where he grows maize and beans to sell to schools and commercial customers. He faces a challenge of changes in weather conditions that affect farming. He has been farming for 5 years now. He hopes that in future he will be able to expand his farm and also buy a lorry to transport his produce to the market.

He has taken a loan of KES 12,900 to buy a solar lamp.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two  children with ages 18 months and 4 years. She describes herself as committed and aggressive. 

She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment, hair plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as bad debts. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy hair weaves, cosmetics and other salon materials. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, cosmetics and other salon materials.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and she has continued studying even while the family is in financial crisis. All of this has make Angelie double her effort in pursuing her dreams. 

She has taken out a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit in order to cover the costs of school tuition fees. She is hopeful to finish her coursework and be able to work in any company in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition fees

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
Jaime, vive con su familia, su esposa y su hijo de 2 años de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos, dicho oficio lo aprendió de charlas que recibió en la Iglesia donde se congrega y lo desempeña desde hace 4 años, la ventaja que posee es que son productos para el hogar  y realiza la venta  en los buses.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería en abundancia tales como: lamparas, llaveros, entre otros productos para ofrecerles a los clientes; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mayor mercadería en su negocio.
Su sueño es lograr tener su negocio propio y estable.
texts.en:
Jaime lives with his family, including his wife and his son, who is 2 years old. He has no relatives living abroad. Jaime sells a variety of products. He learned the trade from talks he received in the church he attends and he began his business some 4 years ago. An advantage he has is that he sells products useful in the home. He makes his sales in the buses.

The loan Jaime requests will permit him to purchase merchandise in abundance, including flash lights and key chains among other products to offer his customers. This investment will help him acquire more merchandise for his business.

Jaime's dream is to have a proper and stable business.

loans.use: buy flash lights and key rings, among other products, to sell on buses.

loans.name: Tiebine

texts.fr: Né en 1973 et père de 06 enfants dont 04 scolarisés, Tiébine exerce comme activité l’agriculture depuis 1999 aidé par 08 personnes, il  sollicite de WAGES un premier lui permettant d'améliorer son activité. Mr Tiébine voudrait à l’avenir assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et augmenter sa superficie cultivable.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 and the father of six children, four of whom attend school, Tiébine has been doing business in agriculture since 1999. He is assisted by eight people, and is currently seeking his first loan from WAGES, which will enable him to improve his business.

In the future, Tiébine would like to provide for his children's schooling and increase his arable farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farming tools.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
This is Brenda, 30, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alfie, her business partner, and they have children. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Brenda operates a market stall. She sells vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetables and sells them per kilo. She also sells fresh fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Since she is just renting her stall, she is hoping that she will have her own. She dreams to have a happy life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Karla Yanet

texts.es: Karla es originaria de Estelí, tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, una niña de 11 años y un niño de 8. Ella es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de pollo hace seis años, fue una idea que ella tenía desde hace mucho tiempo, trabajaba en otros negocios que no eran propios, su principal apoyo ha sido su familia. Su producto lo comercializa en barrios cercanos,  este negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y le gustaría expandirlo para aumentar la cantidad de clientes.  Con el tiempo piensa poner una distribuidora de pollo, ya que su negocio se ha mantenido estable. El préstamo lo solicita para comprar pollos y huevos, logrando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Al obtener este préstamo será de mucho beneficio para su negocio, ya que aumentara la cantidad de productos y clientes, lo cual le generara mayores ingresos. Su meta próxima es comprar un local propio para poner una agencia distribuidora de pollos.
texts.en: Karla is originally from Estelí.  She is 35 years old and a single mother with two children - an eleven-year-old girl and a boy of eight years old.  Karla makes a living as a businesswoman and has been selling chicken for ten years.  She had had the idea for a long time, when she was working for other businesses.  Karla's family have been her bigger supporter.  Karla sells her products in nearby barrios.  The business is her only source of income and she would like to expand it, in order to increase her number of customers.  In time, she would like to start a business distributing chickens, as her current business has kept her stable.  Karla is applying for this loan in order to buy chickens and eggs, thus satisfying her customers' needs.  This loan will be of great benefit to Karla's business as she will increase the quantity of products and customers that she has.  In turn this will increase her income.  Karla's next goal is to buy premises so that she can start a business distributing chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicken and eggs.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan para salir adelante. Ella, posee una tienda, lo desempeña desde hace 5 años y lo realiza de 6:30am a 7:00pm, por el momento no tiene competencia, ya que su tienda es la única. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de productos para su negocio tales como: frijol, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
Su sueño es tener un multi súper establecido.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her husband and both are working in order to get ahead.  Cristina has had a shop for five years, and she works from 6.30am until 7pm.  With no other shops in the area, Cristina has no competition.

Cristina needs this loan as it will allow her to buy a variety of products for her shop.  She needs to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil and other items..  This investment will help Cristina to satisfy her customers' needs.

Cristina's dream is to have a large, well-established shop.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil and more.

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en:
Latifan is a 42-year-old married woman. She works hard to provide better living standards to her nine children by selling wooden sticks. Wooden sticks are used in manufacturing furniture. Her husband purchases from the market and then she sells them in the furniture market. She has become famous by providing good quality wooden sticks and has retained many customers. She earns enough to support a decent life. 

For the further improvement in her business she requested for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy more bundles of wooden sticks to inflate her sales. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment schedule. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of wooden sticks.

loans.name: Kristiana

texts.en:
Her name is Kristina. Kristina and was born in Sejiram, Kapuas Hulu, West Kalimantan, on July 7, 1996. She was the first child and has four brothers. Her father and her mother work as an elementary school teacher in the village. 

Her dream is to become an expert in shipping and transportation management. Because Indonesia is an archipelagic nation, certainly there are a lot of jobs in the field of shipping and transportation management.

Kristina recently graduated from high school. She wants to continue her studies at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara Cilacap, Department of KPN. Kristina chose AMN for two reasons, first because her parents cannot afford tuition for Kristina, and second, as an expert in shipping and transportation management, she will be able to quickly get a job in Indonesia or a foreign company. So Kristina can achieve her goals without  burdening her parents and can provide greater opportunities for her younger siblings to attend school.

To be able to achieve her goals, Kristina is willing to go far from her parents and younger siblings to attend school on the island of Java. Kristina chose AMN college in Cilacap, because Kristina got information from her uncle who works in YSBS that in Cilacap there is the AMN Student Loan program for students from poor families. This program gave her great hope and Kristina is very excited because then she can go to college and later can achieve her goals. Kristina said, "But the excitement and hope is still dependent on the kindness of all of you, and depends on your generosity to lend me money for school fees. Please help me. I promise to return the loan later when I've graduated and am working. For your generosity, I say thank you. "

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Desde hace más de 10 años se encarga de administrar su propia tienda. 

La compra de los productos para la tienda en su mayoría se los llevan a su casa y no tiene que salir a comprarlos; ya que los distribuidores se los hacen llegar, solamente va a comprar los fines de semana los pocos productos que no se le hacen llegar, como verduras, entre otros.

EL Préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mercadería para su tienda, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos y ropa especialmente ropa para niños que es un producto que lo demandan sus clientes y él no lo tiene disponible.  Al tener mas productos a la disposición podrá mejorar sus  ingresos los cuales le ayudaran a que él y su familia estén mejor económicamente.

A futuro, Comenta que quisiera seguir trabajando de la forma que lo viene haciendo o mejorar aún más para que a su hijo tenga las comodidades necesarias para poder sacarlo adelante en sus estudios y pueda formarse como todo un profesional graduado de la universidad.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 29 years old.  He has a partner and a six year old son.  He has been running his own shop for ten years.

Gustavo orders his products in bulk and they are delivered to his home, saving him from having to go out to buy them himself.  Gustavo only goes out at the weekends to buy the few products, such as vegetables, which are not delivered.

Gustavo is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to buy more merchandise for his shop.  He will buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, soft drinks and clothing, particularly children's clothing, which is in demand and he does not currently have available.  When he has more products available, Gustavo will be able to increase his income, helping to improve his and his family's financial situation.

In the future Gustavo says that he would like to continue with this work and to improve it so that he has the necessary for his son to get ahead in his education and to go on to study at university.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his shop.  He will buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, soft drinks and clothing, particularly children's clothing, which is in demand and he does not currently have available.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old, married father of two children. For 15 years, he has been employed in an aluminum manufacturing company. His wife doesn't work, and one of his children is currently enrolled in a public school. All of these aspects put so much pressure on him to work harder in order to cover his family's needs.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a car that will facilitate most of his family needs and will help him to start taking private aluminum requests after working hours. This car will be the best way to transport his required tools and materials until he becomes financially capable of opening his own aluminum work company.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help him start his own business.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат умная женщина. Она получила высшее образование благодаря своим родителям. Она благодарна своим родителям. Фарогат работает преподавателем русского языка в средней школе. Фарогат имеет большой опыт в сфере преподавания. Фарогат замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети были тоже образованными людьми. В этом году один из ее детей поступил в университет в столице Таджикистана. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, а также оплатить за аренду квартиры, где ее ребенок будет проживать. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1800 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farogat is a smart woman.  She obtained a higher education thanks to her parents.  She is grateful to her parents.  Farogat works as a Russian-language teacher at a secondary school.  Farogat has a lot of experience in the educational field.  Farogat is married and raising two children.  She always dreamed that her children would be educated people too.  One of the children got accepted to a university in the capital of Tajikistan this year.  Farogat has to pay for the tuition contract and also for an apartment lease, where the child will live.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1800 US dollars.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child's tuition contract and also for an apartment lease

loans.name: Bonventure

texts.en:
Bonventure operates a barber shop where he offers hair cutting services. He describes himself as aggressive. His primary customers are males. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank that will benefit two members of his family. He faces a challenge of water harvesting, hence the need of a water tank. This will enable him to store and access clean water for domestic use. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in future he will be stable and successful.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Suela

texts.en:
Thanks to you Suela was able to buy what she was looking for with the previous loan and also pay off the loan on time and in full. 

Now she is requesting another loan and she hopes that lenders will assist her financially again. When she was interviewed by the loan officer, she did not hide the appreciation to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional dressmaking accessories.

loans.name: Yoert's Group

texts.en:
Yoert is 38 years old and married. She has one daughter. She and her husband live in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. 

She has made a living by growing rice, beans and watermelons for 12 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day.
 
Yoert’s group consists of two members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now Yoert is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cultivated land. With this loan, she hopes to grow his crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Sandra Inés

texts.es: Sandra Inés es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 años. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, una cafetería que tiene hace 11 años, donde ofrece variedad de productos como mecato, jugos, gaseosas, café, confitería entre otros. Es una persona luchadora y entregada a su trabajo y a su familia, trabaja arduas jornadas todos los días de la semana y, con esto ha podido obtener dinero para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. El crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea invertirlo en la remodelación del piso del local, ya que el que tiene actualmente se encuentra en mal estado; con ello logrará darle una mejor imagen a su negocio y cambiará la percepción de las personas que transitan por el lugar y así logrará atraer más clientes e incrementar las ventas y por ende los ingresos, para poder brindarle una excelente educación a su hijo, mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Sandra Inés is 42 years old, married and has an eleven-year-old son.  She currently makes a living through her business - a café, that she has had for eleven years, where she offers a variety of products, such as pastries, coffee, sweets and more.  Sandra is feisty and dedicated to her work and family.  She works long days, every day of the week, and thus can earn money to support her household and buy provide her family with the bare necessities.  Sandra is applying for a loan to renovate the floor in her premises.  The floor is currently in a bad state and, with this improvement, her business will have a better image and passers-by will have a better perception of her café.  Thus Sandra will attract more customers and increase her sales and, consequently, her income.  She can then provide her son with a good up-bringing and improve well-being and quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to renovate the floor in her premises.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna was born in a small village in Laung, Kapuas Hulu, West Kalimantan. Ratna is an only child, coming from a family background that is not well off. Her parents do not have decent educations, so she does not have a steady job. Her father only received education up to high school graduation and the mother did not complete primary school. Her parents are small farmers who work on farms owned by others, and their income is not enough, so they are not able to send Ratna  to college.

Ratna wants to continue study in college to improve the economic condition of the family. She wants to become an expert in nautical science. Because Indonesia is an archipelagic nation, certainly there are a lot of jobs in the field of nautical science, both for domestic shipping and international shipping. Ratna dreams of becoming a ship captain so she can sail around the world.

Ratna wants to continue her study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara Cilacap, Department of Nautical science. Ratna choose AMN because her parents could not afford college. Once she becomes an expert in nautical science, she can get a job in Indonesia or in a foreign company. Ratna wants to achieve her dreams without  burdening her parents. The Student Loan Program from Kiva will establish high expectations for Ratna, because then she can go to college and someday be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
At the age of 37, Shahnaz is a married woman and running a business of milk sales with her husband. She has been doing it for a period of about five years and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  Over the time, Shahnaz has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has two buffalo in milk and she counts a good client list.  

She is a mother of five children and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. 

In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She wishes to spend part of profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Dzidodo/bolou-Kpeme Group

texts.fr: Madame Abra est mariée à un cultivateur. Elle a en charge 03 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 12ans et le dernier 06ans. Elle même a 31ans. Madame Abra est dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis 2000. Son activité est centrée en RÉGION MARITIME (dans une ville nommée TSEVIE) et dispose de trois personnes qui l’aident pour l’avancement de son activité. Elle fait partie d’une association « DZIDODO» qui signifie « COURAGE » dont elle est la responsable. Elles sont toutes dans le domaine de l’agriculture et cette activité leur procure des revenus considérables leur permettant de prendre soin de leur famille. Le premier prêt  qu’ils sollicitent leur servira à s’approvisionner en outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Elles espèrent augmenter leurs superficies cultivables et assurer un bien être à la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Abra is married to a farmer. She is raising three children, all enrolled in school.The oldest is 12 and the youngest six years old. She herself is 31 years old.  

Madame Abra has been working in agriculture since 2000. Her work is located in RÉGION MARITIME (in a town called TSEVIE) and she has three people who help her advance her agricultural pursuits. She is a member of an association called « DZIDODO» which means « COURAGE » of which she is the leader. They are all in the field of agriculture and this work brings them considerable income, permitting them to take care of their families. This first loan that they are requesting will be used to buy agricultural tools in order to have a good harvest. They hope to add to their arable land and ensure the well-being of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima previously requested a loan for 18,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy more used-but-quality clothes needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household and business expenditures.

Naima is requesting another loan for 28,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more used-but-quality clothes needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better the profit. Her profits from business will help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

Naima hopes that her business will last longer and that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes

loans.name: Ramy's Group

texts.en:
Ramy, 23 years old, is married and has one son. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband earn a living through planting rice, watermelon, and beans. They supplement the income by fishing. Having been in this business for two years, together, they can earn about KHR 27,000 per day from the current business and manage to save about KHR 16,000 each day, after offsetting expenses.

Ramy has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Ramy will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income, to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркуль, 47 лет, вдова,воспитывает 3 детей (1 дочь 2 сына). Образование-среднее. С 1997 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 5 000 сом (KGS). Несмотря на потерю кормильца семьи, Атыркуль все-таки нашла в себе силы выстоять и продолжить разведение скота и развитие полеводства. На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Также у нее в наличии имеется 1,20 ГА земельного надела, где она ежегодно сажает картофель и фасоль.   Ежемесячная прибыль Атыркуль составляет 10000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Атыркуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота. Дети помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Атыркуль планирует увеличить поголовье скота. Семья очень уважаемая в селе и дружная. Атыркуль является лидером группы "Келечек - Н", в составе группы 3 человека и Атыркуль является одним из членов группы.
texts.en: Atyrkul is a 47 year old widow with two sons and one daughter. She has a high school education and has been growing crops and raising farm animals since 1997, when she started a business with 5,000 somoni. Despite the loss of her husband, who was the family's breadwinner, Atyrkul found the strength in herself to keep the farm going. Today she is a successful farmer with three milk cows, one horse, and 20 head of sheep and goats. She also has 1.2 hectares of land to grow potatoes and beans. She earns 10,000 somoni per month and her children help out around the farm. The family is friendly and well-respected in the village. In order to continue developing her business, Atyrkul asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 somoni to buy cattle and increase her herds. Atyrkul is the leader of the three-member Kelechek-H group.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an additional income from vegetable vending.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jiguisseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIMPIALA II, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  KOROTIMI 1ère debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter :0.5hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 45.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called JIGUISSEME II are married women with an average age of 41 and five children on average, all living in polygamous families in ZIMPIALA II, one of the villages of the Sous-Préfecture (county) of KOLONDIEBA, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Korotimi, the first person standing on the right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. to cultivate one half hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in KOLONDIEBA, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 45,500 F CFA each season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. for this planting season.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 39-year-old, married woman. For two years, she has been doing a business of tailoring to financially support her husband. She accepted the fact that, if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to efficiently meet the expenses of household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. She, together with her husband, manages their household, while operating a business. 

At this time, Tahira is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000/- to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons and laces. In this way, Tahira will be able to stitch up more dresses for her customers. 

Tahira hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges. 

Josephine is requesting a KES 40,000 loan to boost her retail business, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost her retail business, purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Abed Al Salam

texts.en:
Abed Al Salam is a 50-year-old, married father of four children, who has had a hookah-selling shop since 2009. He is well-known in his region, with his special quality and prices provided to his customers. His wife is employed in a school, but their combined revenue isn't enough to cover all of their family's needs because of the high cost of living these days. 

Abed Al Salam works hard for his family's happiness. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to help his son with his engagement ceremony expenses, as his gift, since he can't afford taking this amount directly from his business capital.

He hopes to keep on responding to his family's needs and expanding his business.

loans.use: to help his son with his engagement ceremony expenses.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIMPIALA II, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec ADIARATOU 1ère assise à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1.5hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called JIGUISSEME III are married women with an average age of 33 and four children on average, all living in polygamous families in ZIMPIALA II, one of the villages of the Sous-Préfecture (county) of KOLONDIEBA, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Adiaratou, the first person sitting on the left in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. to cultivate one and a half hectares. Her produce is sold in the village and in KOLONDIEBA, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 105,500 F CFA each season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. for the growing season

loans.name: Jiguisseme Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISSEME IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIMPIALA II, un des villages de la Sous-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec NAMINATA  1ère à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called JIGUISSEME IV are married women with an average age of 35 and four children on average, all living in polygamous families in ZIMPIALA II, one of the villages of the Sous-Préfecture (county) of KOLONDIEBA, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Naminata, the first person on the right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. to cultivate one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village and in KOLONDIEBA, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 85,500 F CFA each season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay for plowing, etc. for the growing season.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en: Siony, who is 40 years old, is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by planting vegetables in her village. She earns about Php 400 weekly and is requesting a loan for Php 17,000 to buy seedlings for her vegetable farm. She's hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
This is Lailani. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lailani dreams that her business will continue to expand. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Gisella Yaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variedad en su gastronomía que la hacen única.

Aquí vive la señorita Gisella, tiene 22 años y es soltera, estudia ciencias para la Educación  en la Universidad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos y con estos continuar con sus estudios para tener un mejor porvenir.

Doña Gisella además de estudiar también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos de Esika, Lebel y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que ella les vende a  sus compañeras de clases y los fines de semana visita a otros clientes que tiene en la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad  con la cual ayuda a sus padres y sale adelante en sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The Virgen María communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton.  The canton is known for its rich pre-colonial history and its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  The city has a warm climate and a variety of cuisines, which makes it unique.

This is where Gisella, age 22 and single, lives.  She is studying education at the university.  She lives in her parents’ house.  She has been in the communal bank for three years.  She likes it because, thanks to the loans, she started her business.  The business allows her to earn her own resources, and with these resources, continue her studies in order to have a better future.

In addition to studying, Gisella also sells clothes and all types of Esika, Lebel, and Sayson (beauty products, perfume, and women’s accessories) products.  She works every day because she sells to her classmates.  On the week-ends she visits other customers that she has in the city.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects every week.  She has been engaged in this business activity for three years.  She helps her parents and gets ahead in her studies with the business.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and clothes.  Her dreams are to complete her education and to get a good job.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Norlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Norlie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store, buying and selling charcoal, and farming vegetables. Norlie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional young coconuts to sell for her coconut business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her coconut business and her other businesses.

Norlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional young coconut to sell

loans.name: Mushirambeho Group

texts.fr:
Sharthiel  fait partie du groupe  Mushirambeho et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a  33 ans et est mariée à  Renilde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 9enfants.
  
Il fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme   à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une parcelle et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Sharthiel is part of the group Mushirambeho and lives in Rumonge. He is 33 years old and married to Renilde, a farmer. Together they have nine children.

Sharthiel has been doing commerce in palm oil for ten years. 

He is on his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large amount of palm oil to resell in order to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of palm oil to resell in order to  earn more

loans.name: Francisco Octavio

texts.es: Francisco Octavio es un hombre de 29 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la actividad musical, pues hace parte de una banda, vive con sus padres, quienes son su motivación para salir adelante, ya que la carga económica la tiene su padre, quien trabaja en construcción y es muy incierto el empleo en esa actividad, por lo tanto, la economía de la familia es muy inestable. Es una persona enérgica, emprendedor y con ganas de salir adelante. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en el pago de una asesoría especializada para crear empresa, pues quiere montar su propio negocio con unas bases sólidas, con el fin de obtener ingresos para mejorar la economía en su hogar y ayudarle a su padre con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su principal sueño es poder tener su negocio independiente, bien acreditado, que le permita manejar su tiempo para poder continuar con su banda musical.
texts.en: Francisco Octavio is a 29-year-old man who is single and does not yet have children. Currently, he works in the field of music, since he is a member of a band. He lives with his parents, who are his motivation for getting ahead, because the economic burden is borne by his father, who works in construction; employment is quite uncertain in this field, so that the family's economic situation is very unstable. Francisco Octavio is a very energetic and enterprising person with a desire to get ahead in life. The loan he is requesting will be invested in paying for specialized training to start a business, since he would like to set up his own business on a solid foundation, with the aim of earning income to improve his household economy and to help his father support the family. His main dream is to have his own independent business on a firm footing, which will allow him to manage his time so that he can continue with his musical band.

loans.use: to pay for specialized training to set up a business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 43 years old and operates a business of manufacturing waan, which is a material used in making charpoy, a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan. She offers various kinds of waan in different colors and has become famous in providing good quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. 

Razia is requesting her fourth loan from Kashf for 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more spools of threads of different types, such as silk and nylon, in various colors to inflate her sales.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads in silk and nylon in various colors.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra, age 36, earns a living by selling milk. She earns enough to lead a decent life with help from her husband. She is the mother of four and is committed to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She has gradually improved her business with support from the Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 4th loan cycle and is requesting Rs. 35,000.  She intends to use this loan to buy another cow. This will increase her sales and profits, and give her more money to spend on her family.

loans.use: to buy a new cow.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is married, with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

Mwatime sells Leso (women's wrap cloth). Her business has been operational for the last three years. Her potential clients are neighbors and town-dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase 60 pairs of Leso (women's wrap cloth) for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase 60 pairs of Leso (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Kpedenou -Ekpui-Tsive-Vogan Group

texts.fr: Âgée de 67 ans, Madame Tonoussi est agricultrice. Elle est responsable du groupe KPEDENOU – Ekpui – Tsivé- VOGAN. Cette femme mariée a deux enfants de 28 et 19 ans, dont un est toujours dans la vie étudiante. Elle entame son deuxième cycle dans notre institution de micro finance(WAGES).  Elle est à la tête d’une entreprise de quatre employés. Et ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter sa surface cultivable, mais également d’investir dans son activité de petit commerce.  Ainsi madame Tonoussi  pourra elle aussi assurer la santé et le bien être de sa famille. Elle assurera de plus la formation de son dernier enfant. Ce crédit permettra en outre le développement de toute l’agriculture locale. Les 13 autres personnes étant dans des situations similaires à celle de madame Tonoussi  et exerçant la même profession.
texts.en:
Ms. Tonoussi, aged 67, is a farmer. She is the official of the group KPEDENOU – Ekpui – Tsivé- VOGAN. She is a married woman and has two children, 28 and 19 years old, of whom one is still a student. Ms. Tonoussi is starting her second [loan] cycle with our microfinance institution (WAGES). 

She is the head of an enterprise of four employees. And this loan will enable her to increase her arable land but also invest in her small-scale business.  Thus, she will also be able to ensure the health and well-being of her family, as well as her youngest child's training. This loan will furthermore enable her to develop the local agriculture entirely. The thirteen other persons, being in the same situation as Ms. Tonoussi's, work in the same profession.

loans.use: to purchase work tools

loans.name: Turemeshanye Group

texts.fr:
Odette  fait partie du groupe Turemeshanye et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 39 ans et est mariée à  Joseph, un garnisseur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 12 à 19 ans, tous étudient.
  
Elle fait le commerce de riz depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  devenir une commerçante  grossiste.
texts.en:
Odette is part of the group Turemeshanye and lives in Bujumbura. She is 39 years old and married to Joseph, an upholstery. Together they have two children, aged 12 and 19 years old, both in school.

Odette has been doing commerce in rice for eight years. 

She is on her sixth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice to resell in order to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito De Rocafuerte  (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días los socios del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Éxito de Rocafuerte. Este grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres  y 2 hombres, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, con el cual esperan aumentar sus negocios para el bienestar de sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Carmen Dolores, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niñas,  una de 4 años y la menor de 2 meses de nacida, vive con los padres. Ella es Ing. en Contabilidad y Auditoría.

Doña Carmen Dolores para salir adelante junto a sus pequeñas hijas se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella también realiza trabajos contables para ciertos  lugares y personas que requieren de sus servicios, con esto ella se gana algo por su trabajo que junto a sus ganancias de su negocio le sirven para sacar adelante a sus pequeñas. Trabaja casi todos los días ya en sus labores contables o realizando sus recorridos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ciertos materiales de oficina para sus trabajos contables. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal,  es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan con los créditos. 

Su sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujers De Éxito de Rocafuerte communal bank meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton.  This group is comprised of ten women and two men.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers prepare and are known throughout the country.  The members combine their efforts in order to be able to access the benefits that the Fundación Espoir provides.  With these benefits they hope to expand their businesses for the well-being of their families.

Carmen Dolores, age 32, is one of the members of this group.  She is a single mother with two children, ages four and two months.  She lives with her parents.  She is an auditor and accountant.

In order to get ahead, together with her two young daughters, Carmen Dolores sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) products.  She also does accounting jobs for certain places and people who require her services.  With this she earns something for her work, which together with her income from her business, serves her to get her little ones ahead.

She works almost every day with her accounting work or making her rounds of sales.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects each week.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over ten years, and it allows her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and some office supplies for her accounting jobs.  She has been in the communal bank for four years, and she is the president.  She likes it for the help that is provided with the loans.  Her dream is to give her daughters the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and office supplies.

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She operates a retail shop where she sells cooking oil, salt, sugar etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are commercial and local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be robbery. 

She will use the Kes 6,900 loan to buy a solar lamp. Her business goal is to expand her business and serve customers to their satisfaction within five years. She also has a farm where she grows maize, beans and groundnuts to sell to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Mao, 38, is a married mother of two children. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming on a three-hectare area of farmland and planting soybeans. To earn more income, they have been catching fish. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 18 years.

Mao is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Mao will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Chhneang's Group

texts.en:
Chhneang is aged 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area of Sangke district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their income by catching fish. Having been in this business for 11 years, together they can earn about KHR 6,000 per day. 

Chhneang has been with VisionFund for three cycles, and she completely paid back the prior loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on materials for supporting her fishing business. She hopes to grow her business and plant more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has one child who is 13 years old. She describes herself as God-fearing. 

Judith operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are commercial and local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be robbery and low capital. 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker. Her business goal is to open several branches within five years.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is from Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. There, she runs her retail store, selling motor spare parts and accessories. She has been doing this for many years to make a living. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children.

In 2010, she joined GDMPC, and recently she borrowed a loan. She used it to purchase additional motorcycle parts, accessories, and oil. She plans to improve her business, by starting to provide motorcycle repair services at her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional motorcycle parts, accessories, and oil

loans.name: Chy's Group

texts.en:
Chy is living in a rural village of the Sangke district, in Battambang province. Chy is a 46-year-old mother of seven children. She and her husband have been earning a living by catching fish to sell, for ten years. In this business, they earn about 50,000 KHR per day.

Chy’s Group is comprised of two members who live in the same village. Chy is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chy wants to use her portion of the loan funds to buy materials to use in her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish and sell them on time, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her fishing business

loans.name: Rafaqat

texts.en:
Rafaqat is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of milk sales for the past 14 years to support her family. She has one calf and two cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. 

Rafaqat has two daughters and one son; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her ninth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through this support.

 Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calf. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.
