Aside from the farming business, San is skilled in making things from clay such as piggy banks, which she sometimes sells for money. 

San reported that things went well for her family with the previous loans she had from HKL. This loan will be her sixth loan cycle, which she is seeking in order to buy a motorcycle for her children's commuting. It is also for buying wooden material for constructing a store in front of her house, where she will sell her piggy banks to local people. She is very pleased and thankful for the opportunity provided, as she is growing and improving her living status and business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children's commuting

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Pedro est le coordinateur de son groupe Paix de Jesus de Bras de Lance. Il n est`pas  marié et Il  a 2  enfants. Il  habite dans la région nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. 
   
Pedro possede un muni epicerie  et il  vend des produits alimentaires. Avant de ce commencer ce commerce Il était  un écolier. Il  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de Paix de Jesus ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de  cosmétiques et produits divers, etc.  Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord. Pedro dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d'Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Pedro is the coordinator of the group “Paix de Jesus de Bras de Lance”. He is a single man with two children. He lives in northern Haïti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited. 

Pedro owns a small grocery store where he sells various food products. Prior to that, he was in school. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his activity.

Pedro’s biggest challenge is to become a prominent merchant in the northern region. His main goal is to run a substantial business activity that will allow him to build a large house, with the help of Esperanza Int. 

The other members of the group Paix de Jesus need financial assistance for business activities such as the sale of cosmetics, miscellaneous products, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Лутфия трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Один совершеннолетний и один не совершеннолетний. Лутфия более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Ее бизнес является единственным источником ее семейного дохода. Они с мужем расстались, когда дети были маленькие. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и потом реализует на местном рынке. Лутфия  хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. От полученного дохода она хочет обеспечить своих детей, которые растут без отца хорошим условием проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lutfiya is a hardworking woman.  She's a widow and has two children.  One is an adult, they other not yet.  She and her husband separated when their children were little.  For more than 12 years Lutfiiya has worked with livestock.  Her business is the sole source of income for her family.  She buys cattle, fattens them over a period of a few months and then sells them at a local market.  Lutfiya wants to increase her working capital which would increase her income.  She wants to use the additional income to ensure her children, who are growing up without a father, have a good life.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to develop her business.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Sreymom is 21 years old and has been selling grocery items for several years to help support her family. Her previous loan, which was her first, improved her family’s living conditions. Having repaid it, she has formed a group of two to request a new one which she will use to buy more grocery items for resale.

Sreymom hopes that she can earn a good income and extend her business to further improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 55 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy foodstuffs, such as bananas and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 30 years old. She is married, with two children, both of whom attend school. Providence sells various items in her boutique and she has been in the business for five years. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Kumushay

texts.ru: Кумушай, 35 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (4 дочери). На протяжении 15 лет занимается полеводством: обработкой земли и посадкой таких овощных культур, как: картошка и кукуруза. В обработке около 1,5 ГА земли. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. У Кумушай неплохо получается с полеводством, что приносит ей небольшие доходы, ежемесячная прибыль составляет 12000 сом (KGS).  В целях развития своего полеводства Кумушай обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS)  на обработку земли. На доходы от кредита Кумушай планирует улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kumushay is 35 years old, married and has four children, all daughters.  For 15 years, she has worked in agriculture: soil cultivation and growing vegetables crops like potatoes and corn.  Her farm is 1.5 hectares.  Her spouse helps her with the work.  She's good at farming and it brings her a little income.  She has a monthly profit of 12,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her agriculture business, Kumushay has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to help cultivate her land.  She plans to use the income from the loan to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: for land cultivation

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es estudiante del último año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables. Cuenta que su mayor meta es terminar sus estudios y seguir especializándome en el área.
Aspira con poder tener su propio estudio contable, para poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus servicios y también para que de esa forma siga creciendo como profesional, y siga instruyéndose.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Dora is an Accounting student in her final year.  She mentions that her greatest goal is to finish her studies and continue to specialize in the field.

She aspires to be able to start her own accounting office so she can help those that need her services and also continue to learn and grow as a professional.

She is asking for this loan so she can use it to pay for her classes.  It will be a great help to her as she continues to study as she has been doing..

loans.use: pay for college classes.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким житель города Душанбе, столицы Таджикистана. Ему 39 лет. У него жена и двое детей. Хаким, чтобы обеспечивать семью работает на двух работах. Он занимается оптовой продажей булочек и сладостей, а также предоставляет услуги такси. У него имеется машина марки Opel, с помощью которого он осуществляет свою деятельность. Хаким оптом закупает товар с цеха по производству булочек и сладостей, разгружает на своей машине и затем раздает по торговым точкам по приемлемой цене. У Хакима имеются свои постоянные клиенты, которым он продает свой товар. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже 4 года. Одновременно Хаким работает таксистом. Хаким сейчас нуждается в кредите. На половину суммы кредита он хочет закупить необходимый ассортимент булочек и сладостей для продажи, а часть кредита потратить на ремонт дома. Он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Hakim is a resident of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan.  He is 39 years old, married and has two children.  Hakim works two jobs to provide for his family.  He is a wholesaler of biscuits and sweets, and also a taxi driver.  His car is an Orel and it helps him conduct his work.  Hakim buys goods in bulk, loads them in his car, and distributes them to outlets at reasonable prices.  Hakim has loyal clients to whom he sells.  He has had this business for four years.  Meanwhile, he keeps on working as a taxi driver.  Hakim now needs a loan.  Half of it will go to buying a necessary assortment of biscuits and sweets to sell, the other half he will use to make repairs to his home.  He relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy goods (biscuits and sweets) to sell, as well as to make home repairs

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Чамшед является отцом двоих детей. Он имеет высшее образование. По профессии Чамшед юрист. Он не работает по профессии, потому что он не смог найти работу по специальности. 
Чамшед на сегодняшний день занимается растениеводством. Он приобрел автозаправочную точку. Также Чамшед собрал немного денег за счет проданной пшеницы и овощей. Чамшед хочет наконец то открыть автозаправочную точку и начать работу в этой области. С этой целью он обратился в Хумо. Он берет кредит для приобретения топлива и автомобильного масла. Чамшед выбрал хорошее место, приобретенная им автозаправка находится у главной дороги. 
Чамшед ждет Вашей помощи. Может именно Ваша поддержка поможет ему достичь успеха в жизни.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Shahituz region of Tajikistan.  He is 26 years old, married, and is a father to two children.  He has a degree from a university where he studied to become a lawyer.  He is not working in his field because he was unable to find work as an attorney.  Jamshed now works in agriculture.  He purchased a gas station and he has saved some money from the sale of his grains and vegetables.  He now wants to finally open his gas station and make this his new line of work.  With this goal, he has turned to HUMO.  He is taking out a loan to buy fuel and motor oil.  Jamshed has chosen a good location, his station is right on a main road.  He awaits your kindness.  Your support very well may help him achieve success in this life.

loans.use: to buy fuel and motor oil to open a gas station

loans.name: Nelly Group

texts.en:
Iman is the featured borrower of Nelly Group. She got with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Iman is a 52-year-old, married woman, who has been working in sewing and preparing hand-made souvenirs to help her husband in making their living and covering their two children's expenses.

Her acquired loan will be invested in buying a special, updated sewing machine that will make part of her work easier and faster. In the photo, she is on the right, with a veil covering part of her face.

As for the other members, Nada is a 50-year-old, married mother of three children. She works as a tailor and her applied for loan will be invested in covering some unexpected, urgent family needs. She is the one standing in the center of the picture.

And Rana is a 44-year-old, widowed mother of two. She works as a tailor too. Her applied for loan will be invested in paying her deceased husband's financial dues. She is the one wearing black, at the left.

loans.use: to buy a special, updated sewing machine.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of milk sales for the past ten years. She has two calves and two cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

Farzana is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It is her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with their support. 

Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохиста трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и он там подрабатывает разнорабочим. Шохиста уже более 7 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она умелая портниха. Шохиста предоставляет услугу швеи на высшем уровне и ее клиенты довольны ею. Она накопила немного денег для покупки мебели для своего дома, но ее деньги не хватают для покупки мебели. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 Сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shohista is a hardworking and ambitious woman.  She is 25 years old, married and has one child.  Her husband is a migrant work in Russia where he works as a part-time laborer.  For more than seven years Shohista has worked offering her services as a seamstress.  She is a skilled dressmaker.  She provides tailoring services of the highest quality and her clients are very satisfied.  She has saved a little money to buy furniture for her home, but she doesn't have enough.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 KGS to make the purchase.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora, que se esfuerza por ir mejorando cada día más. Cuenta que gracias a sus padres inicio su carrera, ya que ellos le ayudaron bastante en cuanto a lo económico. De aquí a dos años ya terminará su carrera de Contabilidad y Auditoría. También comenta que aspira a ser una excelente profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very enterprising and hardworking person who strives to improve every day.  She says that she was able to start working on her degree thanks to her parents.  They have helped her a great deal, financially.  She will finish her Accounting and Auditing degree in two years.  She also says that she aspires to be an excellent professional who helps others.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay her college fees.  In this way, she will be able to continue studying and growing.

loans.use: pay her college bills.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
essica es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es  alumna regular del 5to. año de la Carrera Derecho, está estudiando en una de las mejores universidades del país.
Ella es la mayor de dos hermanos y trabaja en el Poder Judicial en donde trabaja hace un año. Su meta es llegar a ser abogada y gran profesional, ya que le dedica mucho tiempo a la lectura de sus libros. Aspira con ser una de los mejores y así poder ser útil para su familia y la sociedad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y también poder cubrir los gastos de las clases. Ella es una buena estudiante y quiere ser una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Jessica is from the city of Carapeguá and is a 5th year Law student.  She is studying at one of the best universities in the country.

She is the oldest of two siblings and has been working in the Judicial Branch for one year.  Her goal is to become a lawyer and a great professional, since she spends a lot of time reading her books.  She aspires to be one of the best and in this way be able to be useful to her family and to society.

She is asking for this loan to pay for her school fees and also pay expenses for her classes.  She is a good student and wants to be a great professional.

loans.use: Pay her college fees and expenses for her classes.

loans.name: Pedro Fernando

texts.es:
Pedro, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita capital de trabajo para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos; este le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, venenos y foliares, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior le permitió aumentar la productividad, sus ganancias y estas las utiliza para cubrir  los gastos básicos del hogar;  las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Pedro is requesting a new loan because he needs operating capital for planting basic grains. The money will help him to buy farming supplies such as compost, poisons, foliar fertilizers, and other items.

The effect of his previous loan helped to increase his productivity. His earnings were used to cover his basic household expenses. Pedro’s financial condition improved and his family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy compost, poisons, foliar fertilizers, and other items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with six children, all of whom attend school. Her husband financially supports his family. They live in their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Fatuma operates a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and beans to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Chanry, a 33-year-old married mother of two children still too young for school, earns a living selling various kinds of vegetables. In this business for 10 years while her husband works as a paid worker, she earns about 29,000 KHR per day.

Chanry's previous loan with Kiva partner VisionFund, completely repaid, helped improve her family’s living conditions. She is now seeking 500,000 KHR as her portion of this two-person group loan for 1,400,000 KHR. Chanry will use her portion to buy vegetables for resale. She hopes to improve her business and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: María Cielo

texts.es: María Cielo es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 18 años. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, ropa, lencería y bisutería; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de su familia y, con ella ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar. La prestataria es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir apoyando a su familia económicamente. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita con la Corporación y desea invertirlo en la compra de más surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son familiares y amigos. Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas para darle un mejor bienestar a su familia con el apoyo económico.
texts.en:
María Cielo is a 42-year-old woman, is married, and is a mother to her 18-year-old son.  Currently, she works selling merchandise via catalog, including clothes, lingerie, and imitation jewelry.  She started this business thanks to the support of her family and with it she has been able to obtain income that goes towards the support of her home.

She is enterprising and hardworking and wants to progress so she can continue to support her family financially.  This is the second loan that she has asked for and she wants to use it to buy more of her merchandise (clothing, perfume, accessories, and lingerie).  In addition, she will be able to increase her sales and offer a greater variety of products that will satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers (most of whom are friends and family members).

Her main goal is to have a large amount of goods and expand her clientele with good customers.  In addition, she hopes to increase her sales so she can improve her family's quality of life with her financial support.

loans.use: stock up on her merchandise (clothing, perfume, accessories, and lingerie)

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier es de la ciudad de Lambaré, está casado, y aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos. El es dueño de una Aguateria llamada “la Alborada”,  ubicada en la ciudad de San Antonio.
Su aguatería fue adquirida en el año 2008 como herencia, junto con terrenos en esa zona, en ese tiempo tenia aproximadamente entre 90 y 130 usuarios. En la actualidad más de 300 familias que son asistidas por la red de distribución  de agua potable, ya que se encuentra en una zona que se está loteando y gradualmente crece en la cantidad de usuarios. Gracias a este servicio esta ayudando a las personas que necesitan este servicio tan importante como lo es el acceso al agua.
Tiene antigüedad y experiencia. Esta actividad además de generarle ingreso, contribuye a satisfacer la necesidad básica de acceder a  agua potable por parte de los pobladores de la mencionada zona.
Javier solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el servicio de mantenimiento de maquinas, motores motobombas para su red de distribución, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo y ayuda de la forma que lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Javier is from the city of Lambaré.  He is married, but they haven't yet had the good fortune of having children.  He is the owner of an aguatería (private water provider) called "La Alborada" (Dawn), which is located in the city of San Antonio.

He inherited his aguatería in 2008 along with land in the area.  At that time, he had about 90-130 users.

Currently, more than 300 families partake of his water distribution network.  This is because the region where he lives is being divided up and the population is gradually increasing.  Thanks to this service, he is helping people have access to this service, which is needed because water access is so important.

He has experience in this type of business.  In addition to giving him income, he helps satisfy the basic need of access to drinking water to the population of his region.

Javier is asking for this loan so he can maintain his machines and water pump motors for his distribution network.  In this way, he can continue with his work and provide help to his community.

loans.use: pay to maintain his machines, vehicles, and water pumps.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl es un señor de 47 años de edad, su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 14, 17 y 20 años. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo y allí, gracias a su padre conoció las labores agrícolas, pues tiene cultivos de papa criolla, papa capira y arvejas desde hace 30 años. El prestatario es un hombre luchador, dedicado y muy trabajador, pues labora largas jornadas en sus cultivos y vende las cosechas que produce, con lo que ha podido obtener ingresos para el sustento de toda su familia. Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, fungicidas, semillas de papa y de arveja) para continuar con sus cultivos y sacar más cosecha para  venderla. Su principal sueño es poder ampliar sus cultivos ya que tiene disponibilidad de terreno para hacerlo y, de esa manera aumentar las ventas de las cosechas y generar más ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 47-year-old man; his family consists of hi wife and three children aged 14, 17 and 20 years.  He was raised his entire life in the countryside and thanks to his father learned to do agricultural work there; he has grown several types of potatoes and peas for the last 30 years.  The borrower is a hardworking dedicated man for he works long days on his crops and sells the harvests he gets and has earned income that way to support his entire family.

He will use the requested loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, insecticide, fertilizer, fungicide and potato and pea seeds) to continue with his crops and to yield larger harvests to sell.  His main dream is to be able to expand his crops because he has land available to do so and thus increase sales of crops and generate higher income to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry es de la ciudad Lambaré, y actualmente están en el segundo ciclo. Con los créditos que acceden ellas invierten en sus respectivos emprendimientos, para poder ir creciendo y mejorando cada día para poder ayudar a su familia.
Martina es una de estas mujeres, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y lucha del día puede tener los ingresos y medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Su deseo es poder tener algún día un gran local donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes las delicias que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos que vende, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes, jamón, queso y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” committee is from the city of Lambaré and is currently in its second cycle.  They invest the loans they get in their various enterprises in order to grow and improve daily to help their families.

Martina is one of these women.  She sells food she makes herself.  She comments that thanks to her effort and daily struggle she is able to earn income and have means by which to help her family.  Her wish is to someday have a great place in which to offer her customers the delicious things she makes.

She requests this loan to buy ingredients like vegetables, condiments, meats, ham, cheese, etc. to continue making her food.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva el nombre de Mujeres Trabajadoras  ya que se encuentra formado por 16 integrantes mujeres muy luchadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras, y es por eso justamente que este grupo lleva ese nombre, ellas están en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy responsable,solidario.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Justina de 32 años quien tiene una despensa en su casa, ella gracias a este negocio está ayudando a su familia y tiene los ingresos para ayudarles con lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ninguna necesidad como la que ella tuvo que pasar.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para comprar insumos variados para su despensa, ya que quiere poder ofrecer de todo a sus clientes y de esa forma también aumentar sus ingresos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) since it consists of 16 very hardworking women who are above all enterprising which is precisely why the group is so named.  They are in the first cycle in the women’s committee program; they are a very responsible, mutually supportive group.

One of the stories that’s worthy of mention is Justina.  She is 32-years old and has a home-based grocery store.  Thanks to this business she’s helping her family and she has income to help them with what they need so that they won’t have to go through any privations like she did.

Today, she requests this loan to buy varied merchandise for her store because she has to be able to offer everything to her customers thus also increasing her income.  All of them are grateful for the opportunity they are getting that will be of much help to them.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hilda Idalí

texts.es: Hilda Idalí es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 14 años. Ella nació en el sur de Bolívar y llegó al municipio de Yarumal hace 15 años en busca de mejores oportunidades, allí inició con su sala de belleza, actividad a la que se dedica hace varios años, luego de haberse capacitado en una academia de belleza, además complementa con la venta de mercancía y productos de belleza. Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, se esfuerza diariamente para obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y de su hogar, superando todos los desafíos a los que se enfrenta con la competencia y las temporadas de lluvias que bajan las ventas. Actualmente solicita su sexto crédito con la Corporación, el cual desea invertir en la compra de insumos, mercancía y herramientas de trabajo (cepillos, tintes, barberas, tijeras, ropa, accesorios) para continuar prestando un excelente servicio y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder seguir siendo reconocida en el sector, para generar mayores ingresos. Su principal sueño es tener un local propio que le posibilite la oportunidad de brindar más empleos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda Idalí is a 35-year-old separated woman with two children who are 10 and 14 years of age.  She was born in the south of Bolívar and came to the town of Yarumal 15 years ago in search of better opportunities.  She started her beauty salon there, an activity she’s been doing for several years now having trained in a beauty academy; she also sells merchandise and beauty products.  She’s a very enterprising, hardworking woman who strives daily to earn income needed to support her children and her home overcoming all the challenges that competition and the rainy season create that lead to a drop in sales.

She’s currently asking for her 6th loan from the Corporation that she will use to buy supplies, merchandise and work tools (brushes, hair color, clippers, scissors, clothes, accessories) to continue providing excellent service and offering variety to her customers to continue being well-known in her sector and to generate higher income.  Her main dream is to have a locale of her own so she can offer employment opportunities and better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fry (young fish), fish food, and expand his fish lake.

loans.name: Zari

texts.es: Zari tiene la edad de 31 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Zari is 31 years old and married. She currently lives with her husband and three children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost for maintaining a coffee plantation that she would like to start. Zari would like to adequately maintain this crop so that she can obtain the best production and achieve more income. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. She also wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

This is the first loan Zari has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not received any other previous loans from the state banks, so FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy compost and fumigants.

loans.name: Mi Casita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Mi Casita” está en su Primer Ciclo  del programa de comité , ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse. También están haciendo la encesta de eliminación de pobreza con lo que podrán saber cómo están cada una, gracias a eso se supo que 3 mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Benigna, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Entre el trabajo que ella  hace se dedica a la Confitería, haciendo todo tipo de cosas deliciosas, y gracias a lo cual está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Cuenta que siempre tiene  muchos pedidos, y es gracias a eso que le está yendo muy bien.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  mas ingredientes como harinas, levaduras
Azúcar, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y a seguir creciendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called “Mi Casita” (My Little House) is in its first cycle in the women’s committee program.  They are learning how to work together and how to help each other out.  They are also taking the poverty elimination survey so that they can get to know the situation of each and thanks to it they learned that three of the women are very low income.

One of the members is Benigna who was poverty level one in the last survey, that is to say very low income.  She’s a pastry chef and makes all sorts of delicious things thanks to which she’s getting ahead and helping her family.  She says that she always has many orders and thanks to this is doing very well.

She requests this loan to buy more ingredients like flour, yeast and sugar that will help her improve income and continue to grow in her micro business.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 41-year-old married mother of six children. Five of her children are enrolled in schools, three public and two private. Her husband works fixing car bodies. His low income and the increasing family needs encouraged Layla to start her own business from home. Those who have tasted her food assured her that it has a special quality and they encouraged her to start her own business.
So, in 2009 she started her own food production and sales from home. Layla prepares a lot of frozen food in addition to cleaning and freezing vegetables. 
To improve her business and respond faster to the increased number of customers' requests, she is applying for a loan to buy a special meat mincing machine. That will make her work faster and more professionally and she will also decrease her costs (instead of paying for a butcher for meat mincing) and improve the quality of food produced.
She will also buy another electrical machine specialized for food preparations to expand the range of food prepared.
She hopes that one day she might open a catering company that will serve a lot of weddings and funerals.

loans.use: to buy special machines necessary for making her food production work faster

loans.name: Mentes Positivas Group

texts.es:
Mentes positivas está en su primer  ciclo, están muy entusiasmadas para poder crecer en el emprendimiento que cada una hace. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y dos de ellas están con ingresos muy escasos.
Tomasa es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y está trabajando para mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados y cuenta que cada día le va mejor, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad y eso es lo que gusta a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados de todo tipo, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Mentes Positivas” (Positive Minds) is in its first cycle; they are very excited about being able to grow in each of their business ventures.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and two of them are of very low income.

Tomasa is group president.  She’s a very hardworking woman who strives and works to improve her and her family’s lives.  She works selling shoes and says that she’s doing better every day since she always has a good variety and that pleases her customers.

She requests this loan to buy all types of shoes so that she will be able to continue improving her income.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Thelma Olimpia

texts.es: Doña thelma, habitante del barrio San Sebastián, madre de un hijo quien ya es mayor de edad e independiente, doña Thelma tiene su pequeño  negocio de video juegos y para poder con todos los gastos del hogar también se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica, de esta manera le ayuda a su esposo. Ella necesita mejorar  su vivienda, por eso acude a solicitar apoyo de crédito para poder realizar la construcción de una habitación en su casa, para vivir en mejores condiciones y sobre todo que le brinde seguridad a la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Thelma resides in the neighborhood of San Sebastián. She is the mother of an adult son who is independent.

Doña Thelma has a small video game business, which allows her to cover all of the household expenses. She also works as a domestic employee so that she can help her husband. Thelma needs to improve her home, so she is requesting assistance with a loan in order to build a room in her house. This will provide better conditions and security for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to build a room.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 22 years old and married with one child. She has sold various items in her business for the past year. She wants the loan to buy more rice, potatoes and juice for resale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, potatoes and juice for sale

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 44, is married and a mother of six children. She resides in a peaceful village with her husband and some of her children in Battambang province.  Like other families in her village, San and her husband work together to sow rice and seasonal crops as their major source of income. They have been in this occupation for ages.

San is asking for the loan to improve her living situation. She wants to have a hygienic bathroom to serve whole the family. With help from the loan, she’ll be able to buy building materials and pay for labor for constructing the bathroom. Her dream is to improve her standard of living and secure the overall welfare of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, a 40-year-old widowed mother of one child, is a citizen from Battambang province. She makes a living farming six hectares of rice. She has been in this business for ages. This is not her the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Chreb has repaid back her past loan completely which has greatly improved her living conditions. She is seeking for a new loan to buy fertilizer and a good rice seed. She hopes to grow her crop seasonably and make more profit to save some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a good rice seed

loans.name: Houch's Group

texts.en: Houch, age 24, is a married mother of one daughter who is too young to go to school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on five hectares as the main source of her family’s income. She has been involved with this current business in Moung Russey district of Battambang province for five years. Houch has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles with both loans successfully paid back. The previous loans have improved her family’s lifestyle to be better than before. Now, she and her group member are seeking a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia Patricia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años. Ella es comunicadora social y ejerció su profesión durante 14 años, pero la empresa donde laboraba hizo recorte de personal y ella fue despedida; durante 2 años buscó oportunidades de empleo, pero en vista que no consiguió decidió montar su propio negocio, un local de venta de accesorios para dama y exhibidores de bisutería, actividad que le ha permitido generar ingresos para apoyar el sustento  en su hogar. Es una mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, trabaja largas jornadas diariamente. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar más surtido de mercancía (collares, aretes, anillos, pulseras) y exhibidores de bisutería, con el fin de ofrecer más variedad y atraer más clientes. Su principal sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, que le permita incrementar sus ingresos para tener una economía más estable y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia’s a 38-year-old married woman with a 14-year-old son.  She’s a social communicator and practiced her profession for 14 years but the firm she worked for had a staff reduction and she was laid off.  She looked for work for two years but seeing that nothing was available she decided to open her own business, a shop selling women’s accessories and costume jewelry display cases, an activity that has allowed her to earn income to support her home.

She’s a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead; she works long hours daily.  She wants to use the requested loan to buy more assorted merchandise (necklaces, earrings, rings, bracelets) and costume jewelry display cases in order to offer more variety and attract more customers.  Her main dream is to make her business grow so that her income will increase and her economy will be more stable and she can offer her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and jewelry display cases.

loans.name: Divino Niño De Itaugua Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, pero cada una de ella está dando todo de sí para que su grupo crezca y vaya mejorando día a día.
Maria es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza. Gracias a las microfranquicias que les otorga a las mujeres de comité, la fundación puede ayudarlas. Ella está muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza para la venta
texts.en:
The 13 members of this committee engage in various business activities. Each member gives everything she can so that the group can grow and improve day after day.

Maria is part of this group. She produces and sells cleaning products. Thanks to microfranchises that have been offered to the women of this committee, Fundación Paraguaya has been able to help them. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity she has received. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a cleaning products microfranchise. This will enable her to continue making cleaning products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning products microfranchise.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is married with one school-going child. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a fruits and vegetable stall business. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocer in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
Mansura is a 33-year-old a widow with three children. Her eldest son from her husband's first marriage is 21, and two others are 9 and 10. To provide for the family's needs, the eldest son is working as an workman while Mansura sells milk and milk products. To earn a permanent income, a year ago she applied for and received a loan from VFAC to purchase a dairy cow. Mansura has 14 years of experience in this field. At present, she has three cows. 
Her family lives in an old and dilapidated house. Now that Mansura has established her business, she wants a loan to build a new, safe house. Mansura is very happy when sees the smiles on the faces of her children.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a new, safe house.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food.

He operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from his home to his neighbors. He faces a challenge of high transportation costs for his products. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cocking oil

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon is 58 years old with five children. She is a farmer who grows rice on one and one-eighth hectares of farmland while her husband helps to earn additional income by working for others for a fee. She has been a farmer for several years and she can earn about 36,900 KHR per day.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield with good quality rice to earn more income for her family in order to run her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mayra Del Rosario

texts.es:
MAYRA DEL ROSARIO

DOÑA MAYRA LLEVA YA MAS DE TRES AÑOS DE RECIBIR EL APOYO  DE FAPE Y KIVA, LO CUAL AGRADECE Y CONFIA EN QUE FAPE LA SIGA AYUDANDO PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y ASI APOYAR A SU ESPOSO Y DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS DOS NIÑOS. DOÑA MAYRA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE YA MAS DE NUEVE AÑOS A LA CRIANZA DE MARRANOS Y POLLOS Y VENDERLOS CUANDO YA ESTAN MAS GRANDES A UN MEJOR PRECIO, EL AREA DONDE VIVE ES PROPICIA Y COMERCIABLE Y POR ELLO SIGUE LUCHANDO EN SU NEGOCIO PARA SIEMPRE TENER UN INGRESO Y AYUDAR A CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES MATERIALES. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MARRANOS PARA ENGORDE Y CRECIMIENTO, POLLAS PONEDORAS Y CONCENTRADO DE ENGORDE Y CRECIMIENTO, ELLA ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN SGUIR AYUDANDO ATRAVEZ DE LOS CREDITO YA QUE LE HAN SIDO DE MUCHA BENDICION EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Doña Mayra has been receiving assistance from FAPE and Kiva for more than three years. She appreciates and has trust in FAPE for continuing to help her move forward so that she can support her husband and provide the best for their two children.

Doña Mayra has been raising pigs and chickens for more than nine years. When the animals reach a large size, she is able to sell them at the best price. The area where she lives is suitable for business, so she strives to continue her work in order to always have an income for material needs.

Mayra needs a loan so that she can buy pigs for fattening, egg-laying hens, and concentrated feed so that her animals will grow. She hopes to continue receiving support with the loan since they have been a great benefit to her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, egg-laying hens, and concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de la ciudad de pilar, comenta que es músico, pero que también aspira a ser un gran abogado.
El proviene de una familia numerosa, y su meta es poder ayudarles por medio de su trabajo y de su profesión. De aquí a cierto tiempo se ve siendo un gran músico y un gran Abogado.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir financiando sus estudios y así estar más cerca de cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Ramon is from the city of Pilar, says he is a musician and aspires to be a great lawyer.

He comes from a large family and his goal is to be able to help them through his work and his profession. He sees himself as a great musician and a great lawyer in the future. 

Ramon is requesting this loan in order to invest in the payment of his fees, thus continuing to finance his studies and be closer to fulfilling his dream.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está en su ciclo número 6, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una en todo sentido. 6 de esas mujeres se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos.
Maria es una de las integrantes, quien en su encesta mostró estar en un nivel medio. Ella entre el trabajo que hace cuenta que vende frutas, verduras y trabaja como empleada domestica. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por salir adelante, es por eso que hace de todo para poder mejorar e ir creciendo.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras frescas, ya que de esa forma podrá ir mejorando y teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Jesus' Sacred Hear"t group, is on it's 6th cycle, they are all going through the poverty survey to understand their full situation. Six of these women have very low income.
Maria is one of the members, her survey showed a medium level.  Among her activities is the sale of fruits and vegetables, she also works as a maid.  She is a woman that has made sacrifices and fights to get ahead, that's why she works on all sorts of things to improve and grow.
Today she requests a loan to invest it in buying fresh fruits and vegetables this way she will improve and have better income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ariziki Group

texts.fr: Femme de 45ans, madame Pyalo est agricultrice de profession. Elle a pour mari un cultivateur et maman de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Son activité se déroule en région centrale et elle s’approvisionne au même lieu. Aidée par 03 personnes, Pyalo sollicite le premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Responsable du groupement nommé ARIZIKI, elle et les autres membres sont tous dans le domaine de l’agriculture et plus précisément la culture du mais. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elles voudraient avoir un bon rendement et assurer la scolarité de leurs enfants.
texts.en: A woman of 45 years of age, Madame Pyalo is a farmer by profession. Her husband is a farmer and she has three children of whom two are enrolled in school. Her activity is located in the central region and that is where she buys her supplies. Aided by three persons, Pyalo is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy agricultural tools so as to have a good harvest. She is the leader of the group called ARIZIKI, and she and the other members all work in the domain of agriculture, more precisely growing maize. As far as future plans go, they would like to have a good harvest and ensure that their children attend school.

loans.use: to buy tools for agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost and fumigants for his chili pepper crops.

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.en: Pierrine is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 12 years. She is married to a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. They will save the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Lawrencia's Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ghana! This is 30-year-old Lawrencia from Teshie. She is a married parent with one child. 

Lawrencia sells clothing and has been operating this business for seven years. She says the main challenge is not having enough capital to buy more so that she can make more profit.

Lawrencia has requested a loan of GHS 1,300 to purchase materials to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her profit and, hence, allow her to pay fees for her child. In the future, Lawrencia plans to open a grocery.

Her partner is Augustine, who sells electronic gadgets.

loans.use: To purchase materials to resell.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, 45, lives with her husband and three children in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. She grows rice and watermelon as the main sources of her income. She has been involved with this current business for 28 years and can earn about 30,000KHR per day.

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid her past loans which have helped her improve her living conditions and keep her children in school. Now she is requesting a new loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that her family’s living conditions will continue to improve.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fariaal

texts.en:
Fariaal is 23 years old and single. She has had her beauty parlor for two years. She is smart to have thought to start a beauty parlor in her home. Her mother is also an entrepreneur, who sells bed sheets to the people of her community and other cities. Fariaal offers many services to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials. Through her good work she has become well-known in the area and makes a good income to contribute to her family.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a bigger variety of cosmetic products for the beauty parlor. Because she had little cash in hand she contacted the Kashf Foundation. Fariaal applied a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy make-up kits, hair rollers and cleansers to cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy make-up kits, hair rollers and cleansers.

loans.name: Nacline

texts.en: Nacline is 29 years old. She is married with two children. She would like a loan to buy more food to resell. The profits from the business will be saved to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana es de la ciudad de Ybycui, ella es una mujer muy luchadora, que esta luchando por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Cuenta que su meta siempre ha sido poder ayudar a los demás, y por medio de sus estudios podrá hacerlo.
Esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y cuenta que se esta esforzando mucho para poder ser una de las mejores en su carrera y el día de mañana ser una profesional excelente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que por medio de ello podrá seguir con sus estudios y luchando por cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Rossana is from the city of Ybycui. She is a very determined woman who strives to improve her life and that of her family. Her goal has always been to help others, which explains why she is pursuing her studies.

Rossana is studying for a degree in Nursing. She is doing the best that she can as she earns her degree so that someday she will be a successful professional. Rossana is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her tuition payments and fees. This will enable her to continue with her studies as she strives to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 52 years old. She is a widow taking care of one child, aged 12, who goes to school. Vestine has been selling food for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, beans and sorghum to resell. She plans to save the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en: A rural villager in Kandal province, Chamroen is a farmer who grows rice in the local area while her husband works for others to supplement the family’s income. She has four children, two of whom are still in school. From the current business, which she has had for four years, she is able to earn about 12,800KHR per day. Chamroen has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she leads a group of four to apply for a loan. She and her group members are seeking 160,000KHR each. She will use her loan to buy materials to construct her latrine. She hopes that she can build a decent latrine for her family to improve their hygienic practice.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct her latrine.

loans.name: Sak's Group

texts.en: Sak is 46 years old and a married mother of eight children. She lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. To support her family, she farms rice as the main source of her family’s income and supplements her income by growing cassava. She currently earns about 28,000KHR per day. This is the first loan for Sak and her one group member with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000KHR while her group member is requesting 300,000KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her crop yield to earn more income to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea is 34 years old and a citizen from Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district. She lives with her husband and five sons. Her main source of income comes from selling desserts, while her husband works as construction labor for additional income. Her current business, which she has had for four years, earns her about 11,400 KHR per day.

Sokea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan: 160,000KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy materials to build a latrine (barrel, seat, pump, and tank). She hopes that her family can have a decent latrine to provide them with better hygiene.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a latrine.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house with no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past two years, he has operated a farming business where he plants and sells his farm products from home to neighbours and passersby. His major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan he wants to purchase six bags of fertilizer and seeds to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of fertilizer and seeds to sell.

loans.name: Juan Nicolás

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Machala.  Desde que se asentuaron en Puerto Bolívar, ha trabajado en la pesca artesanal junto a su familia y sus hermanos.  Generalmente trabajan desde la mañana, para posteriormente salir y pescar en alta mar.  Es casado y tiene 4 hijos; su esposa trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante, mientras que 2 de sus hijos van a la escuela y los otros 2, al colegio.  Necesita el crédito para invertirlo en materiales para su actividad (mallas y plomos).
texts.en:
This client lives in the city of Machala. Since settling in the neighborhood of Puerto Bolívar, he has worked as a fisherman alongside his family and his siblings. Generally he works in the mornings, leaving early so that he can fish on the high seas.

The client is married and has four children. His wife works as a cook at a restaurant. They have two children who attend elementary school and the other two are in high school. He needs a loan so that he can invest in materials for his business (nets and lead weights).

loans.use: to buy nets and lead weights for his business.

loans.name: Walberto Enrique

texts.es: Walberto tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del 	Atlántico, con su conyugue y dos (2) hijos, con edades entre 16 y 18 años. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de pescados, como bocachico, mojarra lora, bagre, y también vende gallina criolla. Estos productos los comercializa a clientes de barrios circunvecinos a su barrio de residencia. Vende de contado, de lunes a domingo, de seis (6) a.m. a doce (12) p.m.. El pescado lo compra en Tasajera, que es un corregimiento del departamento del Magdalena, población netamente pesquera, que se encuentra a la orilla del mar caribe, y de la cienaga grande de Santa Marta. Cuenta que a la edad de doce (12) años, empezó a trabajar vendiendo verduras en un carro de mula, posteriormente, laboró como ayudante de ebanistería, y en el año 2001, inició su negocio de comercialización de pescados, es decir, que a la fecha tiene doce (12) años de estar en este negocio. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de pescados y de productos congelados. Espera con esta inversión crecer en el negocio, para beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Walberto, age 40, lives with his wife and two children, between the ages of 16 and 18, in the city of Barranquilla in the Atlántico department.  His business consists of buying and selling fish like  lizardfish, sea fish, and catfish.  He also sells organic chicken.  He sells these products to customers in neighborhoods around where he lives.  He sells for cash on Mondays through Sundays from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.  He buys the fish in Tasajera, which is a small town in the Magdalena department.  Its inhabitants are fisherman, and it is located on the banks of the Caribbean Sea and the Ciénaga Grande de Santa Marta.  

He says that when he was 12 years old he started to work by selling vegetables from a mule drawn cart.  Later, he worked as an assistant cabinetmaker.  In the year 2001 he started his business of selling fish.  That is to say that he now has 12 years of being in this business.

This is his first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy fish and frozen products.  With this investment he hopes to grow in the business in order to be of benefit to his family.

loans.use: to buy fish and frozen products from the sea.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: Ramón Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de mercaderís para la pulpería, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el consumo humano y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su pulpería y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramón Gerardo is 67 and lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority.  He intends to use this loan in order to purchase merchandise for his grocery store.  This will enable him to offer his customers a greater number of high-quality products.  By making this purchase he aims to increase his income so that he can reinvest in his business and meet his future goals of improving his family's quality of life.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought him this loan with greater ease and at interest rates that are much lower.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos , vive con los hijos y el papá  en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales para la agricultura. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un negocio propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y en mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 and the single father of two children. Luis and his children live with his father in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province in Ecuador. 

Luis is a member of the Cevallos Communal Bank, which is located in the rural community of San Francisco, in the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo. The Bank's members make their living doing agricultural work.

Luis is a farmer and grows corn and soybeans. He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, and herbicides. This loan will allow Luis to purchase agricultural inputs, which he buys in Ventanas. 

Luis's dream is to have his own business. The challenges he faces are infestations and bad weather. In his free time, Luis likes to play football.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 34-year-old divorced woman with two children who go to public school. She lives in the village of Tezi.  

Natia’s economic activity is her newly-started store in a suburb of the capital city, where she sells household items. She started this business several weeks ago, so it needs support for further development. 

As she lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected her loan request. It was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the loan she is asking for, Natia will purchase more merchandise such as plastic dishes, hygienic items, etc. She will renew the assortment and expand her product inventory. It is obvious that the job is hard for her, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually.  

Natia is a very enthusiastic and hard working person, with a great desire to ensure her children receive a good education to progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana has been operating a bar café that has been frequented mostly by, let's say, the neighborhood’s mature men for the past three years. Now she wants to renovate the façade and the interior of the bar café. This is how the loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used.

It has almost become a tradition in Albania in the recent years that residents discuss the top stories and topics on business and politics, and they can't wait to meet to share the news:) While in the cities, café bars are usually frequented by both genders, in the villages and towns these very same places are frequented almost 100% by mature men, where they spend sometime in the morning and evening, too, to say “hello” to each other. 

This type of business can turn out to be a good one, but of course, it is a small family activity. 

Liljana is married and has four children; they all live in a city in southeastern Albania.

loans.use: to renovate the facade and interior of the bar café.

loans.name: Amenata

texts.en:
Amenata is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and she was unfortunate to attend school. She has five children between the ages of 9 and 21; only three of her children are living at home and attending school.

She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past seven years, she has been selling fashion slippers in the local market.  She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM.  She likes her business because she has lots of customers; she started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared taxi to get her fashion slippers to her business spot. 

Amenata is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. 

Her dream is to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Carrera” está integrado por seis mujeres y un hombre; todos viven en una misma comunidad, todos se conocen desde hace ya varios años. En dicha comunidad, las personas aún conservan su lengua materna: el mazahua. La mayoría de las mujeres aún visten sus trajes típicos muy coloridos, la fiesta más celebrada de la comunidad es el día 14 de septiembre celebran “El señor de los milagros”. 

Doña Lety, como le dicen de cariño, es integrante del grupo es una persona muy entregada a su familia, pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, estudio únicamente la secundaria, ella tiene 30 años de edad está casada con el señor Alberto quien trabaja como albañil, están casados desde hace ya 12 años, juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños de los cuales cuatro de ellos asisten ya la escuela. Doña Lety tiene una tienda de abarrotes y un molino para moler el nixtamal (Maíz para hacer tortillas) desde hace ya dos años, Lety comenta “Mi motivación por iniciar mis negocio fue porque el lugar donde vivimos no hay una tienda ni un molino cerca para poder encontrar estos servicios yo y mis vecinos teníamos que caminar varios kilómetros”. Esta ella vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más productos de abarrotes como sal, azúcar, pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, productos enlatados etc. En sus negocios le va muy bien porque como no hay ninguna tienda que le haga la competencia es por es que sus ganancias son muy buenas. Sin embrago está preocupada porque no tiene un refrigerador donde pueda guardar sus productos lácteos, cuando llega a comprar y no lo puede vender tan rápido muchas veces se le caduca para Lety estas son perdidas de ganancias e inversión, sin embrago esa situación no detiene a Lety para querer llegar a tener una papelería porque igualmente no hay una papelería cercana donde ella vive, los niños tiene que caminar varios minutos para poder adquirir los materiales para sus clases. Lety platica “Estoy muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA por todo el apoyo recibido porque gracias  a los créditos he podido mantener mis dos negocios, en mis ganancias me va muy bien lo cual me ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de mis niños para mi es muy importante que terminen una carrera profesional”. Los integrantes del grupo también están muy agradecidos por el crédito otorgado porque podrán invertir en sus negocios, Alejandra en pollos y borregos, Victoria frutas y verduras, Julia y Laura compraran borreguitos para cría, engorada y venta, Carmen en tienda de abarrotes y Don Alberto en la renta de cimbra (madera para construir).
texts.en:
The group  “La Carrera” (The Race) consists of six women and one man. They all live in the same community and have known each other for several years. In this community, people still preserve their mother tongue: the Mazahua. Most women still wear their very colorful garments. The most celebrated party is community day, also called "The Lord of the Miracles", and is held September 14

Lety, as she is affectionately called, is a member of the group and is a very devoted to her family, but also very hardworking. She was only able to study until high school. She is 30-years-old and is married to Alberto who works as a mason. They have been married for 12 years and have formed a family with five children, four of whom are in school.

Lety has had a grocery store and a mill to grind the boiled corn (maize to make tortillas) for two years. Lety says, "My motivation for starting my business was because where we live there was not a store or a mill close by. To find these services me and my neighbors had to walk several kilometers." 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products like salt, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, canned goods etc. Her business is doing very well because as there is not another store that creates competition and for this reason her earnings are very good. However, she is worried because she does not have a refrigerator where she can keep her dairy products. When it comes to buying sometimes she cannot sell fast enough before the goods expire. For Lety these are lost profits and investments.  Either way this situation does not stop Lety who wants to have a c a stationery store because there is also not a stationery store near where she lives. The children have to walk several minutes to get materials for their classes. Lety describes, "I am very happy and grateful for VisionFund and Kiva for all the support received through the credits because I could maintain my two businesses. My earnings are going very well which helps me improve the quality of life for my children. It is very important to me that they finish a professional degree." 

The other group members are also very grateful for the loan provided because they can invest in their businesses--Alejandra in chickens and sheep, Victoria fruits and vegetables, Julia and Laura bought lambs for breeding, growing and selling, Carmen in a grocery store, and Alberto income in handiwork (wood for building).

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en:
Mahasen is a 33-year-old mother of two children. She and her husband run a convenience store that supports their family financially, since his salary isn't enough to cover their family's increasing needs.

Mahasen is a hard worker and liked by almost all of her customers, who mainly are neighbors, friends and relatives who support her to expand her business more and more.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Holy Ramadan dates and summer cold beverages.

She hopes to be capable of expanding and increasing her business capital and diversity in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Holy Ramadan dates and summer cold beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Rosa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la críanza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para las siembras. El sueño es ser empresario. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta leer sobre los cuidados que se da a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Cantón Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in the town of San Francisco, in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo Parish. Its members work in agriculture. 

Rosa works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She also raises animals such as chickens and pigs. Rosa is applying for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and urea.

With the support of the loan, Rosa will be able to purchase what she needs for her crops. Her dream is be a businesswoman.

In her free time, Rosa enjoys reading about how to care for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is married and has children, one of whom attends school, while the other is an infant. He supports his family financially. They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

He operates a food stall business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators.

With Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and beans for sale. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 29 years old and lives in the area of West Point that has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She and her fiancée live together. They have a two-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Although Rose has not been to school, she describes herself as a hard-working woman. For the past three years, she has been running a stand which sells rice, oil, pepper, etc., in the community market. She spends 9 hours on her business. She likes her business because she has more customers, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. Most of the time she use a shared taxi to get her goods to her stand. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business. Her plans is to build a house and educate her child.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada con dos hijos. Cuenta con 26 años de dedicarse a la profesión de panadería. Oficio que aprendió gracias a que cierto día, una señora amiga suya y que era panadera la invito a que trabajara con ella en la elaboración de pan. Así fue como poco a poco fue aprendiendo hasta que un día decidió instalar su propia panadería. 

ella viaja en autobús hasta la ciudad, aproximadamente siete kilómetros desde su casa, para comprar todos los insumos que necesita para la elaboración del pan.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar, manteca, bandejas donde colocan el pan y otros materiales; ya que con los que actualmente trabaja están casi inservibles. Con la inversión, renovara los utensilios que utiliza en la panadería, ademas que dispondrá de insumos para aumentar la producción, aprovechando que tiene bastante demanda de pan. 

Sus propósitos son, primero que nada cancelar el préstamo y seguir teniendo el apoyo de la institución. También desea mejorar su casa, ya que necesita de mantenimiento y eso requiere inversión Y por supuesto desea  que su panadería crezca cada día mas,  ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
